Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This complex and mineral-laden wine offers tempting scents of chalk, lime and flint that lead to a refreshing and dry palate that carries citrus and crisp apple notes. Bright, nervy acidity gives a mouthwatering balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2019 Estate Grown Vermentino (El Dorado)

Description: Fragrant and savory, this opens with aromas of ripe yellow stone fruit, white spring flowers and citrus. Reflecting the nose, the tangy palate doles out juicy apricot, yellow peach, ginger and grapefruit before a bitter almond close. Crisp acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Campo alle Comete 2019 Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Tangy and enveloping, this savory, medium-bodied white has inviting aromas of Spanish broom and ripe pear with yeasty whiffs of bread dough. On the fresh, succulent palate, notes of fennel and white almond accompany grapefruit and white peach.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guado al Melo 2019 L'Airone Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned berries, eucalyptus, forest floor and dark spice lead the way on this 100% Ciliegiolo. Made with organically grown grapes, it's savory and immediately enjoyable, offering ripe black cherry, star anise and botanical herbs set against lithe tannins. It's a fantastic value at this price point and will pair with almost anything. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rascioni e Cecconello 2019 Rotulaia Ciliegiolo (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with native grape Ciliegiolo and fermented and aged in concrete, this delightful red has earthy aromas of truffle, leather, botanical herbs and wild berries. The lithe palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, ripe blackberry and ground clove before finishing on a note recalling black tea. Fresh acidity and pliant tannins offer gentle support. It's made to be enjoyed young, so drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Piazzano 2019 Ciliegiolo (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of beeswax, cedar and acacia honey follow over to the rounded palate along with yellow apple, citrus and toasted hazelnut. Made with Fiano, it has tangy acidity and savory salinity that keep it energized.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Collazzi 2018 Otto Muri Fiano (Toscana)

Description: Grapefruit and white-peach flavors are highlighted by zesty streaks of tangerine and lime acidity in this full-bodied, thirst-quenching white. Dry and cut by crystalline minerality, it's a varietal Vermentino with broad appeal best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Bourgeois Family 2018 Elicio Vermentino (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Notes of crisp apple and very light herbs highlight this fresh, tangy and spotlessly clean wine. Light body and expressive fruit and white-pepper flavors make it a treat to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2020 Vermentino (Amador County)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: This bone-dry, restrained and light-bodied wine brings a sense of austerity to the palate due to its lean apple and herb flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: RD 2019 Fifth Moon Malvasia Bianca (Suisun Valley)

Description: Crisp and pristine, this vibrant, focused sparkler has delicate aromas of hawthorn, white stone fruit and citrus. Racy and bone-dry, the savory, gleaming palate delivers juicy Meyer lemon, Anjou pear, saline and a hint of bread dough. Tiny, persistent bubbles provide the elegant backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dal Maso 2016 Pas Dosé Riserva Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Tantalizing aromas of white stone fruit, wet rock and baking spice take shape on this vibrant sparkler. Dry and delicious, the racy, focused palate delivers ripe Bartlett pear, unsweetened lemon drop and mineral notes recalling graphite and saline. It boasts great energy, structure and elegance as well as a crisp, pristine close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandro de Bruno 2015 Extra Brut 36  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Crisp but also boasting complexity, this energized, precise sparkler has aromas of mature white stone fruit, pressed chamomile flower, dried botanical herb and aniseed. The dry, racy palate features ripe yellow apple, Meyer lemon, saline mineral notes and yeasty hints of brioche alongside vibrant acidity. A refined, persistent perlage further fuels the energy and finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattori 2013 Roncà Non Dosato Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Citrusy and mineral-driven, this pristine, racy sparkler features aromas of yellow spring flower, white stone fruit and a dollop of honeyed almond. On the dry, energized palate, an elegant, persistent perlage and crisp acidity accompany Golden Delicious apple and Meyer lemon while a mineral vein of saline lends depth to the close. Great focus and finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fongaro 2014 Pas Dosé Bio  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Racy and focused, this radiant sparkler has enticing aromas of citrus, hazelnut, sage and a whiff of underbrush. The bone-dry, delicious palate has knife-like precision and depth, delivering yellow apple, Meyer lemon, slate mineral notes and hints of white pepper alongside crisp acidity. An extremely refined perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetto 2013 Metodo Classico Dosaggio Zero Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this radiant sparkler has aromas of yellow spring flower, ripe yellow apple, citrus zest and hazelnut. On the focused, dry palate, racy acidity energizes yellow pear, Meyer lemon and flinty mineral while a refined perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fongaro 2014 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, citrus and wet stone waft out of the glass. On the racy, almost vertical palate, crisp acidity accompanies Meyer lemon, orange zest and Golden Delicious apple while an extremely refined, persistent perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetto 2015 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of mature white stone fruit, acacia honey and balsamic notes form the nose on this lovely sparkler. On the dry, radiant palate, honeyed mineral notes underscore mature yellow apple, lychee and hazelnut before a mineral-driven close. Crisp acidity and a refined, persistent perlage provide the framework.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Moschina 2013 Dosaggio Zero Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Dry and focused, this elegant, vibrant sparkler has delicate scents of white spring flower, yellow pear and a whiff of wet stone. It's dry, crisp and savory, delivering ripe yellow apple, lemon zest and tangy saline before closing on a hazelnut note. A refined perlage and vibrant acidity keep it energized and polished.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Moschina 2015 Extra Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Made from high-altitude vineyards situated 1,640 feet above sea level, this dazzling sparkler opens with aromas suggesting white spring flower, botanical herb, citrus and flint. Boasting freshness and depth, the dry, vibrant palate features ripe yellow apple, crushed mint, grapefruit, lemon drop and underpinnings of mineral. Crisp acidity keeps it racy while a refined perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandro de Bruno 2010 Extra Brut 100 Mesi  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Heady aromas of yellow spring flower, ripe white stone fruit, botanical herb and honey shape the nose. The aromas follow over to the dry, silky palate along with mature yellow apple, hazelnut and a sprinkling of baking spice before a slate finish. Crisp acidity and a light perlage accompany the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandro de Bruno 2010 60 Mesi Extra Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, baking spice, botanical herb and mature white stone fruit form the nose on this smooth sparkler. On the vibrant, savory palate, crisp acidity lifts ripe white peach, lemon drop and sage before a saline finish. A silky perlage lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fongaro 2012 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: White spring flower, ripe white stone fruit, honey and balsamic aromas form the expressive nose. Mirroring the nose, the dry, elegant palate offers acacia honey, ripe yellow pear and a note of lemon drop alongside a refined perlage. Crisp acidity brightens the rich flavors while the barest hint of slate lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattori 2013 Ronca Brut 60 Mesi  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Racy and bone-dry, this has aromas suggesting underbrush, white stone fruit and a whiff of fresh bread dough. On the crisp, precise palate, firm acidity accompanies yellow apple, Meyer lemon and saline mineral notes while a refined, lively perlage lends finesse. This is for lovers of razor-sharp precision and energy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Rugate 2015 Amedeo Pas Dosé Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: This racy, focused sparkler has delicate aromas of hawthorn and citrus. The savory, bone-dry palate features Meyer lemon, yellow pear, botanical herb and saline mineral notes alongside crisp acidity and an elegant perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Io Aura Brut Nature Pas Dosé
Name: Tonello 2015 Io Aura Brut Nature Pas Dosé  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of botanical herb, white stone fruit and almond carry on to the savory palate along with peach and a hint of lemon drop. It closes on a hint of saline while tangy acidity keeps it fresh and juicy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Umani Ronchi 2019 Casal di Serra Bio  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Crisp and dry, this racy sparkler has delicate aromas recalling hawthorn, citrus and a whiff of wet flint. Young and savory, the vibrant palate is pristine, featuring Meyer lemon, grapefruit and tangy saline alongside a refined perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetto 2018 Borgoletto Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of hawthorn, ripe white stone fruit and botanical herb waft out of the glass along with a hint of brioche. On the dry, foaming palate, crisp acidity and a refined perlage accompany mature yellow apple, lemon drop, thyme and hazelnut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colonnara 2013 Metodo Classico Ubaldo Rosi Brut  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Savory and refreshing, this has inviting aromas of chamomile, white stone fruit and a yeasty whiff of brioche. On the dry, lightly sparkling palate, crisp acidity accompanies mature yellow apple, Bartlett pear, saline and a hint of bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Moschina NV Purocaso Vino Frizzante Durella (Veneto)

Description: Light floral and melon aromas lead to a rich palate of ripe apple, pear and pecan flavors that ride an ultrasmooth texture. This medium-bodied wine has a broad mouthfeel and generous flavors that linger into the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2019 Estate Grown Fiano (Lodi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed, old vines and aged in concrete, this medium-bodied white has delicate aromas of white stone fruit, Spanish broom and a whiff of hazelnut. Reflecting the nose, the rounded palate offers ripe yellow pear, lemon drop and honeyed almond alongside bright, tangy acidity. A hint of saline lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Umani Ronchi 2018 Vecchie Vigne  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, underbrush and yellow spring flower form the nose. The dry, vibrant palate offers mature yellow apple, lemon rind and yeasty notes of bread dough alongside a lively perlage and racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa Cecchin 2016 Nostrum Extra Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: This vibrant sparkler has aromas of lychee, citrus and botanical herb. On the palate, a refined, persistent perlage accompanies lemon drop, white peach, aniseed and a hint of smoky flint set against crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tonello 2016 Io Teti Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This has delicate aromas suggesting chamomile, honey and balsamic aromas of eucalyptus. The aromas carry over to the rounded palate along with ripe yellow pear and toasted almond before a hint of saline marks the close. It has an almost glycerine like texture.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Umani Ronchi 2017 Plenio Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Toasted hazelnut, underbrush and brioche aromas form the nose. On the dry, racy palate, crisp acidity accompanies yellow-apple skin, lemon rind, walnut and a hint of saline alongside a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa Cecchin 2014 Dosaggio Zero Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Made with Trebbiano, this has aromas of bread crust, citrus rind and white stone fruit. The vibrant palate offers ripe yellow pear, candied orange slice and a hint of toasted walnut alongside a soft perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baracchi 2016 Metodo Classico Brut Trebbiano (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Tangy and fresh, this offers aromas of fragrant spring flower, tropical fruit and citrus. On the tangy palate, crisp acidity accompanies juicy pineapple, grapefruit and a hints of peach.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Umani Ronchi 2019 Villa Bianchi  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Aromas of citrus, medicinal herb and saline lead the nose on this lively sparkler. On the palate, vigorous bubbles and crisp acidity accompany Meyer lemon, honey, hazelnut, and thyme.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gianni Tessari 2013 60 Mesi  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower mingle with citrus on this lively sparkler. The aromas carry over to the racy palate along with saline notes and a vibrant perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Soave NV Settecento33 Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Scents of white spring flower, brioche and white stone fruit lead the way. On the bright, straightforward palate, lively, small bubbles accompany ripe white peach and candied notes suggesting lemon drop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Soave NV Settecento33 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A slightly muddy yellow-orange hue, this was fermented and aged 10 months in amphorae on the skins. It is a decidedly orange wine. Soft, slightly oxidized and silky smooth, it shows pretty orange and tangerine fruit, more like fruit leather than freshly squeezed. The winery believes it's a style that will age well; time will tell.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Troon 2019 Amphora Amber Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with Verdicchio grapes, this has unusual aromas recalling dill and celery that accent white stone fruit. The straightforward palate shows mature yellow apple, chestnut and toasted walnut alongside lively bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Spumante Metodo Classico Luigi Ghisleri Brut
Name: Colonnara NV Spumante Metodo Classico Luigi Ghisleri Brut  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Fun and foaming, this simple sparkler has aromas and flavors of tart green apple, candied lemon drop and a hint of pastry. Crisp acidity and a soft mousse provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cavazza NV Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, chestnut honey and white stone fruit form the subtle nose. On the foaming, straightforward palate, tangy acidity accompanies suggestions of ripe pear, mature yellow-apple skin and honeyed nuts.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Del Maso NV  Lessini Durello

Description: Aromas of underbrush and toasted nut form the nose along with a whiff of chamomile. The rather assertive palate offers coffee-bean and honeyed notes alongside brisk acidity and vigorous bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Monteforte 2012 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: This opens with aromas of green apple, honeysuckle and tropical fruit. The aromas carry over to the simple palate along with bitter almond and a candied note. Brisk, steely bubbles provide the setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antiche Terre Venete NV Metodo Martinotti Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Focused aromas of melon rind and lemon peel meld with deep, intensely earthy accents of chamomile, thyme and gravel on the concentrated nose of this biodynamic Trebbiano. Rounded and creamy in feel, yet expertly honed by persistent acidity, the palate offers juicy yellow-apple and taut yellow-plum skin flavors dappled in earthy and floral accents. Drink through 2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Emidio Pepe 2015  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: Lightly fragrant and loaded with finesse, this focused white opens with delicate aromas of white spring flower, rosemary, thyme and Mediterranean brush. Smooth and fresh, the palate boasts a weightless, understated elegance that seamlessly offsets ripe yellow pear, juicy Meyer lemon and savory saline notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giovanni Rosso 2019 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Vibrant aromas of lemon zest and yellow apple peel are framed in accents of toast and honey on the nose. Fermented in barrel and aged for 12 months in new French oak, it is creamy, rounded and unctuous on the palate yet driven by tightly coiled citrus, apple and melon flavors all wrapped in a warm, toasty embrace. The energy and lift is substantial, with a brûléed lemon note lingering long on the finish. Enjoyable now, this would hold well through 2025.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masciarelli 2018 Marina Cvetic Riserva  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This iconic Abruzzo bottling doesn't disappoint, offering dense aromas of chamomile, lemon peel, melon rind and white plum on the nose. On the palate, this is all about the texture, which is like a memory foam pillow that both engulfs yet feels supportive. Honed flavors of rich melon, citrus and orchard fruit meld with chamomile and a gentle crushed stone element, yielding a wine that skirts the line between ripeness and tension. It ends taut and lifted, indicating that it will hold well a bit longer in the cellar. Drink through 2025 at least.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentini 2015  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: This amphora-aged Trebbiano boasts rich aromas of white plum, peach and chamomile, with an earthy terracotta accent grounding it all. Rounded and full in feel, the palate is filled out by ripe white-orchard fruit flavors and honed by a bright lemon pith tone. The texture is what really sets this apart: It's silken yet gently grippy, like a soothing cup of white tea.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Francesco Cirelli 2018  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: This creamy yet balanced white offers dense tones of yellow apple, pear, jasmine and chamomile. The palate is like drinking pear-scented white tea, with a gently gripping texture wrapping around all the fruit and floral tones. It ends taut and lingers on a yellow-plum skin tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Emidio Pepe 2016 Pecorino (Colli Aprutini)

Description: Perfumed aromas of yellow apple and cantaloupe are lifted by bright lemon and alpine herb accents on the nose. The rounded palate shows creamy orchard fruit flavors gently dusted with sweet spices and driven by bright, lemony acidity. It's a well-balanced, fuller-bodied white that balances richness and freshness.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Contesa 2018  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Delicious and different flavors like apricot, peach skin and almonds brighten this aromatic, medium-bodied wine, while its rich texture is balanced by a touch of tannin to give it grip and extend the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: La Folia Winery 2017 Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)

Description: From 31-year-old vines, this bubbly is all kinds of wild, starting with a very cloudy appearance then leading into aromas of grapefruit soda, apple sauce and banana. That unique combination shows strongly on the palate as well, where tropical hints of mango and makrut lime add to the attention-grabbing format.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Birichino NV Petulant Naturel Malvasia Bianca Malvasia Bianca (Monterey)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This dramatically tangy and full-bodied dry wine bursts with apricot aromas followed by dusty almond and peach-skin flavors that are bold and mouthfilling. It shows outstanding concentration and firm balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Portalupi 2019 Graziano Vineyard Arneis (Mendocino County)

Description: Focused aromas of lemon rind, white plum and chamomile show depth and concentration on the nose. There's a pleasing creaminess to the palate, with juicy yellow apple and plum flavors lifted by citrus and chamomile accents that linger on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cirelli la Collina Biologica 2018 Organic  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Bright aromas of pear and yellow plum are lifted by accents of lemon peel and white flowers. The rich, creamy palate shows a sultry jasmine and lemon flavor that's filled out by rich yellow fruit, all the while balanced by integrated acidity. There's great concentration, depth and balance in this delicious full-bodied white.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Contesa 2018 Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of orange sorbet, apple and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling from a relatively new project just west of Buellton. Rounded apple, lime-flesh and grapefruit-skin flavors pop on the palate, which is framed by sharp acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brick Barn 2019 Vermentino (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Pretty aromas of citrus peels, green plum and delicate warm spice carry the nose of this rich wine. The creamy palate is pulled along by taut acidity, delivering flavors of saline, lemon and white plum. It's a well-honed medium-bodied white wine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Tollo 2019 Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: Delicate aromas of lemongrass and chamomile ride over a ripe peach core in this Trebbiano from an estate vineyard in Pescara. Light in feel, the palate is carried by spritely white orchard fruit flavors, with lingering accents of lemon pith and white plum skin.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tiberio 2019  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: Aromas of white plum, peach, chamomile and lemongrass show nice concentration on the nose and carry to the medium-bodied palate. It's rounded yet taut in feel, lifted by bright, zesty lemon-tinged acidity that carries all the white fruit flavors to a gentle, stony finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenuta I Fauri 2019 Baldovino  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A bit closed at first, with time in the glass this reveals pretty pear and lemongrass tones. The medium-bodied palate is broadened out by crunchy pear and creamy melon flavors, lifted by saline and bright citrus accents.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenuta I Fauri 2019 Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: This dry wine offers a unique array of honey, nut and floral flavors on a medium body, backed by good acidity for balance. Made in clay amphora, it's more savory than purely fruity in flavor and brings an enjoyable subtlety to the glass.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Domenica Amato 2018 Fiano (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: Here's a dry and robust wine with a gold-brass color that indicates skin contact, an aroma packed with honeysuckle and almonds, and flavors that run to kombucha and hard cider. For such low alcohol, it packs a lot of flavor.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Onward 2018 Skin Fermented Malvasia Bianca (Suisun Valley)

Description: Aromas of greengage plum, gooseberries and grapefruit are bright on the nose. The rounded, juicy palate brings more of the same, with zesty citrus-laden acidity lifting it up. This is fruity and forward yet easy to like.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Talamonti 2019 Trabocchetto Pecorino (Colline Pescaresi)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Bright aromas of guava, melon and lemon peel carry to the medium-bodied palate. This is a fruit-forward white, with a gentle creaminess to it that's nicely balanced by lively acidity. Despite all that fruit, it ends taut and mouthwatering, leaving you ready for the next sip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Terra d'Aligi 2019 Zite Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Bright aromas of guava, melon and lemon peel carry to the medium-bodied palate. This is a fruit-forward white, with a gentle creaminess to it that's nicely balanced by lively acidity. Despite all that fruit, it ends taut and mouthwatering, leaving you ready for the next sip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Terra d'Aligi 2019 Zite Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Description: Boisterous aromas of peach, apple and guava carry this fruity yet fresh white. It's rounded and juicy on the medium-bodied palate, with ripe orchard fruit flavors dusted in hints of cardamom and allspice. Bright acidity lifts it all up, maintaining balance through the fruit-laden finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Talamonti 2018 Aternum  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of ripe apple and yellow plum are dappled with an inviting dried chamomile accent on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is rounded and creamy in feel, displaying juicy orchard fruit flavors honed by fresh lemon and plum skin accents.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Nicodemi 2018 Le Murate  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Brisk aromas of lemon, yellow apple and alpine herbs show good focus and drive on the nose. There's pleasing textural roundness to the medium-bodied palate, lifted by zesty lemon-laden acidity. Ripe apple and melon flavors round it out, giving a gentle creaminess to it all. This tasty white ends on a lasting zip of citrus and herbs.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Tollo 2019 Biologico Passerina (Terre di Chieti)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Nutty, woody aromas lead to rich almond and vanilla flavors in this full-bodied, savory wine. Handsome butter- and almond-cookie accents keep developing on the palate and finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: La Folia Winery 2018 Fiano (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Aromas of chamomile, acacia honey and mature white stone fruit form the nose. On the dry, vibrant palate, a lively perlage and brisk acidity accompany mature yellow apple, honeyed almond, unsweetened lemon drop and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Giacobbe 2013 Cuvée Augusto Dosaggio Zero Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, citrus and Mediterranean herb lead the nose. On the tangy palate, crisp acidity accompanies juicy grapefruit, yellow apple and saline mineral notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fondo Antico 2019 Parlante Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Bright, primary fruit aromas of peach, white plum and grapefruit take on an almost candied edge on the nose. The light-bodied palate is tangy and crisp, enlivened by flavors of tart yellow apple and citrus. A bit of banana creeps in on the midpalate, but this ends brisk and dry.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2019 Costalupo  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Bright aromas of green pear, yellow apple and jasmine carry the nose. There's a gentle creaminess to the medium-bodied palate, with bright, lemony acidity lifting it up and lingering on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Illuminati 2019 Pecorino (Controguerra)

Description: Aromas of creamed pear and apple meld with a savory, buttery note on the nose of this organic Trebbiano. Lightly concentrated yellow-fruit flavors are wrapped in a savory blanket on the palate, sidled by bright enough acidity and a taut, textural finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valle Reale 2018  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: Pretty aromas of yellow apple and white plum are backed by an herbal lemon balm tone. It's rounded and juicy on the palate in tasty orchard fruit flavors, yet honed by taut plum skin and lemony herb accents.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Feudo Antico 2019 Passerina (Tullum)

Description: This straightforward Trebbiano offers brisk tones of white orchard fruit accented by lemon and chamomile. There's some pleasing textural roundness to the light-bodied palate, with fresh acidity lending balance and a gentle savory note marking the close. It's a solid well-priced expression of the variety.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masciarelli 2019  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Brisk aromas of lemon, melon and pear carry to the light-bodied palate. There's a slight creaminess to the feel, with orchard fruit flavors lifted by bright, citrusy acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Tollo 2019 Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Description: Aged five months in stainless-steel tank, this wine is waxy and pungent, with an intensity of deep lemon flavor. Crisp acidity keeps it lively in the glass.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Portalupi 2019 Mahoney Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and citrus are front and center. On the tangy palate, crisp acidity accompanies white grapefruit, pineapple and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Arancio 2019 Superiore Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of gooseberry, grapefruit and peach recall Sauvignon Blanc more than Trebbiano. But, outside of that context, this light-bodied white offers a tasty mix of orchard fruit, citrus and tart berry flavors that will please many, especially at such an accessible price.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Spinelli 2019 Estate Bottled  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Bright aromas of peach and guava carry to the equally fruity palate. A mix of tart orchard fruit, racy lemon and ripe tropical fruit give it a sweet and sour sensation. It skirts the line of underripe, but is enjoyable for it's fruity explosion.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Talamonti 2019 Trebì  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Reserved aromas of yellow orchard fruit meld with a spicy, herbal tone on the nose of this white. It's rounded in feel on the palate, driven by ripe flavors of melon and white plum, with just enough lemony freshness to balance. It ends brisk on a slightly synthetic note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Feudo Antico 2019 Pecorino (Tullum)

Description: Reserved aromas of yellow orchard fruit meld with a spicy, herbal tone on the nose of this white. It's rounded in feel on the palate, driven by ripe flavors of melon and white plum, with just enough lemony freshness to balance. It ends brisk on a slightly synthetic note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Feudo Antico 2019 Pecorino (Tullum)

Description: Aromas of cotton candy, sugar-dusted yellow plum and citrus peels carry the confected nose. More candied flavors arise on the palate, yet it also shows some nice textural roundness and juicy acidity for lift.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Jasci & Marchesani 2019 Nerubè Biologico Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: This lean white has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of paraffin. It's diluted and already evolved, offering mere suggestions of orange rind and bitter notes on the brisk, abrupt palate.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2018 Kisa Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Honeysuckle and green apple aromas follow over to the polished, vibrant palate, along with green melon and pear. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors while an elegant, continuous perlage provides creamy finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ruggeri & C. 2019 Vecchie Viti Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made entirely with the native grape Greco, this sparkler from Campania has heady aromas of white spring wild flower, Mediterranean herb, white stone fruit and bread crust. Racy and elegant, the dry, linear palate offers mature yellow apple, unsweetened lemon drop and a hint of acacia honey alongside a continuous perlage. It closes on a toasted hazelnut note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dubl NV Esse Dosaggio Zero Greco (Vino Spumante)

Description: Green-apple, jasmine and bread-crust aromas fill the glass. Smooth and creamy, the savory palate doles out Granny Smith apple, white peach, citrus and white almond alongside a silky mousse and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: BiancaVigna 2018 Sui Lieviti Brut Nature Glera (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling is incredibly aromatic in all the right ways, offering just enough hints of jasmine, plumeria and coconut oil as well as a brisk line of citrus peel. The palate is vibrant with acidity and scintillating texture, which balance the tropical tones of tuberose and plumeria extract.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vina Robles 2019 Huerhuero Vineyard Vermentino (Paso Robles)

Description: Creamy, dry and delicious, this opens with aromas of Spanish broom, yellow apple, orange zest and bread dough. Refined and savory, the polished palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, white peach and vanilla alongside a silky perlage. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zenato 2017 Metodo Classico Brut  (Lugana)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Creamy and polished, this lovely sparkler offers enticing scents of white spring wild flower and Granny Smith apple. On the palate, a silky mousse accompanies white peach, lemon drop and ripe yellow pear before a white-almond close. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ruggeri & C. NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: San Martino della Battaglia, Veneto, Italy
Description: White flower, tropical fruit and pear aromas lead the nose. On the palate, crisp acidity accompanies green melon, tangy lemon drop and a drop of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Selva Capuzza 2019 Campo del Soglio Friulano (San Martino della Battaglia)

Description: Dry and elegant, this vibrant sparkler carries aromas of hawthorn, white stone fruit and a whiff of almond. These tones follow through to the crisp, clean palate along with yellow apple and unsweetened lemon drop, accompanied by a refined, continuous perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Sei Uno Metodo Classico Rive di Carpesica Extra Brut
Name: Bellenda 2017 Sei Uno Metodo Classico Rive di Carpesica Extra Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Crisp and savory, this polished sparkler has alluring aromas of green apple, citrus and white almond. The aromas carry over to the dry, gently foaming palate along with tangy lemon zest. Bright acidity keeps it refreshingly vibrant.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Gioiosa 2019 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Ripe tones of pear and melon meld with wild thyme and white flowers in this rich, textural white. It's rounded in feel yet properly balanced by integrated acidity and a gentle grip of blanched almond. For those looking for a full-bodied, food-friendly white, this is the ticket.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Statti 2018 Greco (Calabria)

Description: Intense aromas of Granny Smith apple and honeysuckle follow through to the vibrant palate along with candied lemon drop and pineapple packed in syrup. Crisp acidity lifts and balances the rich flavors while a foaming palate lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Rive di San Pietro di Babozza
Name: Villa Sandi 2019 Rive di San Pietro di Babozza  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of beeswax, chamomile and mature white stone fruit shape the nose. On the medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity accompanies ripe yellow apple, honey and white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ugo Lequio 2019 Arneis (Langhe)

Description: This crisp, tangy white has enticing aromas of sea breeze, citrus and white stone fruit. On the savory palate, bright acidity accompanies white peach, juicy grapefruit and pineapple before finishing on hints of saline and white pepper.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Curatolo Arini 1875 2019 Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling begins with clean, pleasant and yet strong lines of peach, apple blossom and lime peel on the nose. There's undeniable ripeness of guava and other tropical fruits on the palate, but the texture is chalky and the acidity is fresh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broken Earth 2019 Limited Release Fiano (Paso Robles)

Description: Boasting crisp tones of greengage plum, crushed stone and a bit of melon, this light-bodied white is made solely from the Pecorello grape, which is native to Calabria. It's taut and bright on the palate in juicy white plum and lemon, with bits of stone and a slight herbal edge chiming in.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Ippolito 1845 2019 Pecorello (Calabria)

Description: Creamy and crisp, this charming sparkler has delicate aromas of hawthorn and ripe stone fruit. The polished palate offers white peach, green apple and candied lemon drop alongside a silky mousse. Vibrant acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santi 2019 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of white wild flower and green apple lead the nose. The creamy, off-dry palate offers ripe white peach, pineapple and lemon drop alongside a foaming mousse. Tangy acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: R.D.O. Rive di Ogliano Extra Dry
Name: Masottina 2019 R.D.O. Rive di Ogliano Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: This rather sweet sparkler has aromas of toasted hazelnut and ripe apricot. The aromas follow through to the foaming palate, along with mature yellow apple, bitter almond and candied lemon-drop notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Merotto NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Aromas suggesting pastry dough, white flower and citrus waft out of the glass. On the rather sweet, creamy palate, a refined perlage accompanies ripe yellow apple, honeyed almond, fig and candied lemon drop. Bright acidity refreshes the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Metodo Classico Rive di Carpescia Dry
Name: Bellenda 2017 Metodo Classico Rive di Carpescia Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow apple, toasted nut and chamomile form the nose on this sparkling dessert wine. The aromas carry over to the foaming palate along with candied orange rind and candied lemon drop. Fresh acidity brightens the sweet flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nino Franco 2019 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: This tasty white seamlessly blends floral, fruity and savory elements to yield a delicious outcome. Orange blossom, yellow apple and crushed salt tones are honed by vibrant acidity, ending smooth and lifted. It's a great wine to enjoy alongside fresh seafood.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Ippolito 1845 2019 Mare Chiaro  (Cirò)

Description: Aromas of green apple and hawthorn shape the nose. The Granny Smith note follows over to the palate, along with white peach and lemon drop alongside vibrant acidity. A foaming mousse provides the backdrop while a hint of almond marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bacio della Luna 2019 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting orange rind, yellow apple and walnut follow over to the racy palate, along with a hint of honeyed almond and a candied lemon-drop note. A silky mousse lends polish, while fresh acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Merotto 2019 Castè Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of ripe white stone fruit, spring blossom and citrus zest lead the nose. On the foaming palate, vibrant acidity accompanies ripe yellow peach, yellow apple and vanilla alongside notes of candied lemon drop and white almond. A creamy mousse offers elegance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Val d'Oca 2019 Millesimato Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Foamy and fragrant, this has delicate aromas of green apple and candied citrus drop. On the sweet palate, bright acidity lifts rich flavors of ripe yellow pear, pineapple packed in syrup, candied orange slice and honeyed almond. A creamy perlage provides the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Graziano Merotto 2019 La Primavera di Barbara Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of jasmine, tropical fruit and green apple lift out of the glass. The fruity aromas carry over to the vibrant palate along with white peach and candied lemon drop before a white-almond close. A silky mousse accompanies the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Gioiosa 2019  Asolo Prosecco Superiore

Description: Green-apple, toasted nut and chamomile aromas follow over to the palate along with candied lemon drop and bitter walnut. A refined perlage and crisp acidity form the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Gioiosa NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of fragrant spring wild flower, tropical fruit and citrus form the delicate nose. On the vibrant palate, bright acidity and a polished mousse accompany Granny Smith apple, white peach and candied lemon drop before a bitter-almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bacio della Luna 2019 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of brioche, yellow apple and toasted nut carry over to the dry palate along with hints of Bartlett pear and lemon zest. Bright acidity and a lively perlage keep it vibrant.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bellenda 2017 S.C. 1931  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut align with grilled herb, white spring flower and white stone fruit. On the palate, invigorating bubbles accompany Bartlett pear, ripe peach and candied tangerine drop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà di Rajo 2019 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: A bold, fruity nose shows a wealth of tropical fruit alongside rose petals and white pepper. The medium-bodied palate has nice weight and concentration, with juicy tropical-fruit flavors honed by bright acidity and a floral orange-blossom tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina di Venosa 2019 Verbo Malvasia (Basilicata)

Description: This has delicate aromas suggesting mature white stone fruit, chamomile and toasted nut. The aromas follow through to the brisk palate along with ripe yellow apple and roasted hazelnut alongside steely, invigorating bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Rive di San Pietro di Barbozza Brut
Name: Val d'Oca 2019 Rive di San Pietro di Barbozza Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: A quiet nose of spring flowers, lemon zest and melon carries to the light-bodied palate. There's a gentle creaminess to it all, lifted by a delicate vein of crushed stone and pushed along by zesty acidity. It's a light, bright wine to enjoy alongside seafood, poultry and roasted veggies.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantine Menhir 2019 Verdeca (Salento)

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting yellow apple and hazelnut. The aromas carry over to the rather evolved palate along with saline notes and vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2017 Sant'Andrea Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Made with organically grown Glera grapes, this has aromas of green apple, pastry cream and citrus. On the off-dry palate, a foaming perlage and tangy acidity accompany white peaches and candied lemon drops.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pizzolato NV Stefany Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of green apple, citrus and medicinal herb are front and center. The aromas carry over to the foaming palate along with lemon drop before a bitter-almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bacio della Luna 2019 Extra Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: White spring flower, white stone fruit and a whiff of botanical herb form the nose. On the crisp palate, a light mousse and bright acidity accompany green apple and bitter-almond before a lemon-drop close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà di Rajo 2019 Cuvée del Fondatore  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Notes of gravel, melon rind and citrus carry the nose of this brisk white wine. There's a rounded feel to the fruit on the palate, with juicy white plum and tangy citrus peels meeting a slight bitter-almond tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2018 Malvasia Bianca (Salento)

Description: Granny Smith apple and toasted nut aromas lead the nose on this foaming sparkler. Reflecting the nose, the tangy palate offers mature pear and bitter-almond alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ciodet NV Lebano Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Granny Smith apple and toasted nut aromas lead the nose on this foaming sparkler. Reflecting the nose, the tangy palate offers mature pear and bitter-almond alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ciodet NV Lebano Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate scents of white spring flower and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. On the crisp palate, racy acidity and a foaming mousse accompany Granny Smith apple and white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santi 2019 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Brisk aromas of lemon, melon rind and crushed stone carry to the lightly concentrated palate. There's a bit of a creamy, yeasty note on the midpalate, but fresh lemony zestiness rises back to bring a crisp finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Mocavero 2019 Curtirussi Verdeca (Puglia)

Description: Packaged in a stunning ridged bottle, this has delicate scents of white spring flower, citrus and a hint of nut. The tangy palate offers mature yellow apple, candied lemon drop and a note bitter almond alongside a lively perlage and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Piccini NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Crisp aromas of yellow apple, green pear and blanched almond start off this straightforward yet enjoyable white. It's tangy and lifted on the light-bodied palate, driven by powerful waves of citrus-laden acidity. There's a mild grip of almond on the finish. This zesty offering needs some food to counteract all that acidity. Enjoy with seafood or poultry.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Taverna 2019 San Basile Greco Bianco (Matera)

Description: Subtle aromas of green apple, spring blossom and sage follow through to the brisk, off-dry palate, along with candied lemon drop. Firm acidity and steely bubbles provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jako Wine NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: A feint nose of lemon, apple and blanched almond starts off this straightforward white. It's light in feel, with tart lemon and orchard-fruit flavors that end on a brisk salted citrus note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Paternoster 2018 Volcanico Falanghina (Basilicata)

Description: Mild aromas of lemon and white flowers carry a candied edge to them on the nose. This is bright and zesty on the palate, boasting straightforward flavors of banana and tangy tropical fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Librandi 2019 Segno  (Cirò)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of green apple, citrus rind and medicinal notes are front and center. The aromas follow over to the brisk, simple palate along with a hint of vanilla and lively, steely bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cecilia Beretta 2019  Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of adhesive bandage and walnut form the nose. The muddled palate is both sweet and bitter, offering ripe white peach, candied notes, astringent medicinal herb and sweet-and-sour sauce alongside harsh, steely bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bacio della Luna 2019 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Fermented in Acacia, this gold-hued white is taut and gripping on the palate. Lemon-peel, apricot-skin and pine flavors are wrapped in tannins reminiscent of over-steeped white tea. It ends a bit bitter and astringent.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Statti 2016 Mantonico (Calabria)

Description: Fermented in the bottle but not disgorged, this has aromas of medicinal herb and adhesive bandage. The pungent aromas carry over to the muddled palate along with hints of yogurt, bread dough and orange-rind set against sharply brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bellenda 2018 VS Extra Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Silky smooth and savory, this stunning sparkler has delicate scents of white spring flower, white stone fruit, fennel and bread dough. Focused and loaded with finesse, the creamy palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, yellow apple and ginger alongside bright acidity and an extremely refined perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nino Franco 2018 Nodi Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: White spring blossom, citrus and pastry dough aromas shape the nose along with a whiff of vanilla on this crisp, lightly sparkling wine. Refermented in the bottle with indigenous yeasts, the savory bone-dry palate delivers mature yellow apple, Bartlett pear, Meyer lemon and white almond set against vibrant acidity. It's utterly delicious, with a tangy mineral finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' dei Zago 2019 Rifermentato in bottiglia  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Racy, savory and mineral driven, this radiant, chiseled semisparkler delivers flavors of ripe pear, apple, tangy white grapefruit and graphite. Made with organically farmed grapes, it boasts vibrant acidity that adds to the mineral tension while a light mousse lends finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Colfondo Indigeno Vino Frizzante Su Alto
Name: L'Antica Quercia 2017 Colfondo Indigeno Vino Frizzante Su Alto  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Heady aromas of hawthorn, white stone fruit and a whiff of crushed botanical herb shape the delicate, enticing nose. The creamy palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, white peach and savory notes of bread dough alongside a silky mousse. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut
Name: Nino Franco 2019 Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of white stone fruit, white spring flower and alpine herb almost leap from the glass in this fragrant sparkler. Polished and savory, the radiant palate features Granny Smith apple, lemon zest and wild sage alongside an elegant, foaming mousse and bright acidity. It closes on a white-almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Sandi 2019 La Rivetta Brut  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: From 40-plus-year-old vines grown in the northern part of St. Helena, this wine has hugely inviting aromas of peach. Dry, it sparkles in acidity and remains sizzling fresh on the palate, with a stony minerality that contributes texture to the light racy core.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lola 2019 Malvasia Bianca (St. Helena)

Description: Opening with enticing scents of white stone fruit, citrus zest and hawthorn, this focused sparkler is savory and elegant. On the dry palate, bright acidity and a tantalizing, silky mousse accompany ripe Bartlett pear, white peach and dried aromatic herb alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a white-almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nino Franco NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Creamy and delicious, this elegant sparkler shows Valdobbiadene's serious potential for yielding savory, compelling wines. It opens with delicate but enticing scents of spring wild flower, white stone fruit and a whiff of hay. It's loaded with finesse, featuring ripe apple, Bartlett pear and hints of sage and almond set against a silky perlage of small continuous bubbles. Bright acidity keeps it balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Cuvée del Fondatore Graziano Rive di Col San Martino Brut
Name: Merotto 2019 Cuvée del Fondatore Graziano Rive di Col San Martino Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit and a delicate whiff of freshly made bread dough waft out of the glass along with a whiff of honeysuckle. The tangy palate features ripe pear, white almond and yellow apple alongside a foaming mousse and fresh acidity before a dry finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: BiancaVigna 2019 Rive di Ogliano Extra Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Heady aromas of honeysuckle and Granny Smith apple are front and center. On the tangy, foaming palate, a silky mouse accompanies flavors of green apple, white peach and candied lemon drop. It closes on a white-almond note while vibrant acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ruggeri & C. 2019 Giustino B. Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Golden-apple and fragrant white spring-flower aromas are front and center on this bright refreshing sparkler. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity and a foaming perlage frame Bartlett pear, orange zest and the barest note suggesting white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nino Franco NV Rustico Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made with organically farmed Grecanico grapes, this fresh, compelling wine opens with enticing scents of Spanish broom, pear, smoke and a whiff of honey. Fermented and aged for seven months in amphora, it's smooth, svelte, savory and yet softly rounded at the same time, delivering dried apricot, lemon drop, savory mineral and briny black olive. It continues to blossom in the glass.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: COS 2018 Pithos Bianco Grecanico (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This creamy, sweet sparkler opens with heady aromas of Granny Smith apple, exotic fruit and candied citrus zest. The aromas follow over to the bright, fruity palate along with white-almond notes and a foaming perlage. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nino Franco 2019 Primo Franco Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: An outstanding expression of the Extra Dry version, this focused, elegant sparkler opens with delicate aromas of spring blossom, ripe white stone fruit, botanical herb and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. The foaming palate shows finesse and flavor, doling out green apple, lemon drop and Bartlett pear before an almond close. A creamy perlage provides silky texture while vibrant acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: BiancaVigna 2019 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes this delicately scented, semisparkler offers citrus, white stone fruit and a whiff of pastry dough. Refermented in the bottle, the bone-dry palate features crisp green apple, juicy pink grapefruit and a hint of graphite alongside vibrant acidity. Make sure to enjoy the whole bottle—the natural sediment at the bottom lends even more flavor to the last glass.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Case Paolin 2018 Col Fondo Vino Bio Frizzante  (Asolo Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of green apple and honeysuckle carry over to the savory palate along with ripe white peach and pear. Made with organically farmed grapes, it features bright acidity and a silky, foaming mousse that keeps it fresh and elegant.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Case Paolin 2019 Brut  (Asolo Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Heady scents of white spring flower, orchard fruit and bread dough form the alluring nose. Made with organically farmed grapes, the bright, savory palate doles out green apple, white peach, vanilla and lemon drop alongside an elegant mousse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: L'Antica Quercia 2019 Rive di Scomigo Matiù Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Enticingly fragrant, this has heady aromas of perfumed spring flower, white stone fruit and aromatic herb. On the dry, foaming palate, bright acidity lifts creamy white peach, crunchy green apple and a hint of honeydew melon before a white-almond close. A silky perlage lends elegance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: BiancaVigna 2019 Rive di Soligo Extra Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Green-apple, spring-blossom and pastry-dough aromas waft out of the glass. Polished and vibrant, the delicious palate doles out creamy white peach, ripe pear and candied lemon drop alongside bright acidity. An elegant mousse gives it a silky texture.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bortolomiol 2019 Ius Naturae  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Fragrant, refreshing and delicious, this opens with aromas of grapefruit, white spring flower and Mediterranean brush. The aromas carry over to the vibrant, savory palate along with juicy pineapple, peach and wild herb before a tangy saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2019 Laluci Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Winemaker Marco Lucchesi is originally from Pisa, Italy, so it makes sense that he's exploring this Italian grape, relatively new to California. Aromas of pink lemonade, surf wax and coconut show on the nose, while the palate is broad with peach rind, apricot and an underlying waxy texture and flavor.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Section Wines 2019 Tierra Alta Vineyards Arneis (Ballard Canyon)

Description: Delicate but alluring scents of yellow spring flower, white stone fruit and Mediterranean scrub form the nose on this elegant white. Racy and linear, the savory palate features yellow apple, lemon drop and saline before a hazelnut close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Al-Cantàra 2018 Luci Luci  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, yellow peach and wet stone mingle with whiffs of hazelnut. Reflecting the nose, the elegant, vibrant palate offers apricot, Meyer lemon, toasted nut and saline mineral notes framed in bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cottanera 2018 Calderara  (Etna)

Appellation: Colli della Toscana Centrale, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Cedar, oak and acacia honey aromas mingle with whiffs of citrus zest. The aromas carry on to the lean, racy palate along with mature yellow apple and unsweetened lemon drop. Elegant and chiseled, with racy acidity, it definitely garners new respect for Trebbiano.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monteraponi 2018 Vite Dimentiche Trebbiano (Colli della Toscana Centrale)

Appellation: Colli della Toscana Centrale, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Cedar, oak and acacia honey aromas mingle with whiffs of citrus zest. The aromas carry on to the lean, racy palate along with mature yellow apple and unsweetened lemon drop. Elegant and chiseled, with racy acidity, it definitely garners new respect for Trebbiano.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monteraponi 2018 Vite Dimentiche Trebbiano (Colli della Toscana Centrale)

Description: Made from a variety more commonly found in Sardinia, this wine makes the case for Carneros, showing a wealth of fresh, inviting peach, lychee and green apple. High-toned acidity highlights a dry crisp salinity and lively style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Uvaggio 2019 Il Nostro Vermentino (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound on the nose, this bottling of a very promising grape for the entire Central Coast shows aromas of wet stone, lemon peel, light honeysuckle and a gunmetal-like minerality. The texture is very stony on the palate, where subtle flavors of white flower and passion fruit emerge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Section Wines 2019 Vermentino (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this has aromas of white stone fruit, white spring flower and a whiff of almond. The fresh palate offers ripe yellow pear and the same almond note from the nose alongside a foaming mousse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: BiancaVigna 2019 Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: This silky sparkler opens with delicate, heady aromas of fragrant spring wild flower, aromatic herb and a whiff of orchard fruit. The foaming palate shows ripe white peach, candied lemon drop and white almond alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: BiancaVigna 2019 Organic Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made entirely with organically framed Catarratto grapes, this zesty white opens with aromas of Spanish broom, chamomile and white stone fruit. The savory, linear palate offers juicy Meyer lemon, honeydew and Bartlett pear alongside bright acidity. It closes on an almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caruso & Minini 2019 Naturalmente Bio Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Fragrant and refined, this fresh, foaming sparkler opens with heady scents of hawthorn and summer orchard fruit. On the vibrant palate, bright acidity and a frothy mousse accompany ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a hint of lemon drop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Sandi NV Brut  (Asolo Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Initially shy, the delicate nose eventually reveals scents of Spanish broom, yellow apple and hazelnut. Made with organically grown Carricante, the dry, racy palate offers lemon zest, pear and a hint of white almond before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Scilio 2019 Valle Galfina  (Etna)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Heady, floral and lemony fresh, this light-bodied wine is fleshy, soft and appealing. More commonly found in Italy and France, here the grapes offer lively character and an inviting taste of peach.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seghesio 2019 Keyhole Ranch Vineyard Vermentino (Russian River Valley)

Description: Delicate aromas of Granny Smith apple and fragrant white spring flower follow over to the vibrant, refreshing palate along with pear and a hint of green melon. It closes on a hint suggesting white almond while a foaming mousse provides the smooth backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Merotto 2019 Integral Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Alluring aromas of white spring flower, white stone fruit and fragrant alpine herb lift out of the glass on this foaming sparkler. The vibrant, off-dry palate delivers green apple, green melon and white almond before a citrus-drop finish. Crisp acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ciodet NV Gelmo Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals delicate scents of white stone fruit, Spanish broom and nut. The bright, linear palate shows an understated elegance, offering mature yellow apple, Meyer lemon and bitter almond alongside vibrant acidity. It closes on a tangy mineral note suggesting saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monteleone 2019  Etna

Description: Aromas of mature white stone fruit, green melon and honeysuckle waft out of the glass. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity and a polished mousse offset white peach, Granny Smith apple a hint of lemon drop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Sandi 2019  Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore

Description: Aromas of mature white stone fruit, hawthorn and citrus mingle together in the glass. The tangy palate delivers ripe apricot, grapefruit and crushed Mediterranean herb set against crisp acidity. It closes on a hint of brine.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio di Pianetto 2019 Timeo Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Veggie-like aromas of chives and snap peas meet up with tangy, fresh herb and green-apple flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It's refreshing, savory and unoaked.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2019 Vermentino (Lodi)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Fruity aromas of white stone fruit and tropical fruit mingle with whiffs of field flower. On the tangy palate, a light, foaming mousse and fresh acidity accompany honeydew melon, green apple and Meyer lemon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Masottina 2019 Rive di Ogliano  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of French oak, vanilla and coconut lead the nose. Made with Carricante and aged for one year in tonneaux, the palate reflects the nose, offering butterscotch, coconut and ripe yellow apple alongside tangy acidity, but the dominant oak sensations muffle its Etna origins and grape variety.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monteleone 2018 Arthemis  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of fragrant white spring flower, tropical fruit and apricot lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the crisp, light-bodied palate shows pineapple and Meyer lemon alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cottanera 2019  Etna

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this bright white has a delicate nose offering scents of hawthorn, Mediterranean scrub and mature white stone fruit. The savory palate doles out ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear, lemon zest and tangy saline set against crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Funaro 2019 Pinzeri Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Airy and bright, this has delicate aromas of toasted nut, white stone fruit and acacia flower. On the palate, bright acidity lifts mature yellow-apple skin, bitter almond and candied citrus drop while steely bubbles provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Canella 2019 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Green apple, spring flower and a whiff of thyme form the nose. The racy palate reflects the nose, offering ripe nectarine, orange zest and a hint of sage alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bortolomiol 2019 Prior Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of ripe green apple, white peach and jasmine fill the glass. The fruity aromas carry over to the off-dry, foaming palate along with candied lemon drop before a white-almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ciodet 2019 Giosuè Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This gently foaming sparkler offers scents of white stone fruit and fragrant spring blossom. On the dry, delicate palate, a soft mousse and fresh acidity accompany white peach, green apple and white almond. Tangy acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ciodet 2019 Bartolo Extra Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate scents evoking spring flower and white stone fruit form the subtle nose. The palate is light and tangy, suggesting yellow pear and golden apple alongside crisp acidity. A hint of saline marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Principi di Butera 2019 Carizza Insolia (Sicilia)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals whiffs of yellow spring flower and the barest hint of white stone fruit. The subdued, racy palate is rather closed but eventually offers suggestions of candied lemon slice and a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Monte Ilice 2018  Etna

Description: Delicate scents evoking spring flower and white stone fruit form the subtle nose. The palate is light and tangy, suggesting yellow pear and golden apple alongside crisp acidity. A hint of saline marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Principi di Butera 2019 Carizza Insolia (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit, fragrant white spring flower and yellow stone fruit lead the nose. On the somewhat lean, racy palate, crisp acidity accompanies citrus and fresh yellow pear. It closes on the barest hint of brine.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2019 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Tropical fruit and honeysuckle aromas lead the nose. On the tangy palate, zesty acidity accompanies ripe yellow apple and an orange-zest note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ottoventi 2019 Punto 8 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: White spring-flower and white stone-fruit aromas form the delicate nose. On the refreshing palate, bright acidity accompanies grapefruit, yellow apple and a drop of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Ermes 2019 Quattro Quarti Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Light bodied and easygoing, this has aromas suggesting spring blossom and yellow stone fruit. Made with organically cultivated grapes, the bright, informal palate offers suggestions of yellow peach and a whiff of grapefruit alongside zesty acidity. It's simple but well made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Ermes 2019 Vento di Mare Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and green apple form the nose. The green-apple note follows over to the tangy, foaming palate along with pear and candied orange drop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Belussi 2019 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Wild herb, cedar, citrus and Spanish broom aromas shape the enticing nose. Savory and elegant, the racy palate delivers ripe apple, Bartlett pear, Meyer lemon and thyme. Vibrant acidity and saline mineral notes lend compelling tension.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2019 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of white spring flowers, Mediterranean brush, citrus and tropical fruit waft out of the glass. On the tangy, totally delicious palate, bright acidity and a saline mineral vein accompany ripe honeydew, juicy orange slice, wild herb and a hint of white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2019 Mozia Fondazione Whitaker Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Racy and delicious, this dry, focused white opens with aromas of citrus, Mediterranean scrub, peach and sea breeze. Grown on the island of Vulcano, off the coast of Sicily, the savory palate reflects its maritime origins, delivering juicy yellow peach, apple, aromatic herb and briny saline alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2019 Capofaro Vigna di Paola Malvasia (Salina)

Description: Crisp, dry and thoroughly delicious, this fragrant white from the island of Salina opens with heady scents of yellow stone fruit, citrus, white rose and Mediterranean brush. Tangy and vibrant, the savory palate doles out yellow peach, apricot, Meyer lemon and briny notes of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2019 Tenuta Capofaro Didyme Malvasia (Salina)

Description: Made with organically farmed Carricante grapes, this delicately scented white opens with scents reminiscent of white spring flowers, beeswax, pollen and pear. Linear and loaded with finesse and energy, the radiant palate doles out yellow apple, hazelnut and saline alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Torre Mora 2019 Scalunera Bianco  (Etna)

Description: This elegant sparkler opens with alluring scents of ripe summer orchard fruit, Mediterranean herb and bread crust. On the palate, bright acidity and an elegant perlage support creamy apple, mature Bartlett pear and lemon drop candy before a dry, tangy finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2017 Metodo Classico Brut Carricante (Sicilia)

Description: This delicious white shows the surprising potential of native grape Catarratto when grown and vinified with care and precision. Opening with delicate scents of spring blossom and grapefruit along with an inviting whiff of bread dough, the savory palate features white peach, green melon and a note of white almond. Crisp acidity and a tangy mineral note suggesting oyster shell give it a bright, mouthwatering close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2019 Tenuta Regaleali Antisa Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Delicate but alluring scents of yellow spring flower, white stone fruit and botanical herb waft out of the glass. Crisp and bone-dry, the elegant, linear palate has racy tension, offering Bartlett pear, Meyer lemon and a steely mineral tone alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tornatore 2019 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Yellow apple, botanical herb and chamomile aromas waft out of the glass. On the racy, mineral-driven palate, crisp acidity and tangy saline notes accompany Bartlett pear and Meyer lemon before a white almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2019  Etna

Appellation: El Pomar District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad, ripe aromas of pineapple, yellow pear and apple peel show on the nose of this bottling. There is a stony streak to the palate, where tightly wound flavors of ash and pome fruit are quite engaging.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Hall 2019 Cavern Select Vermentino (El Pomar District)

Description: The shy nose eventually offers up delicate scents of broom and pear with a whiff of botanical herb. It's racy and chiseled, offering Meyer lemon and ripe yellow apple alongside crisp acidity. An almost salty note adds to the energized tension.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valenti 2019 Enrico IV  (Etna)

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of orange blossom and apple blossom are extremely floral on the nose, which is typical for this variety. There's a pleasant sizzle to the sip, where lime-blossom, green-plum, mango and papaya flavors make for a dynamic sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Saint K 2019 Flower Bomb Malvasia Bianca (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Description: Aromas of broom, mature orchard fruit, honey and grilled Mediterranean herbs form the expressive nose. Reflecting the aromas, the savory, elegant palate delivers ripe yellow apple, candied orange zest, fennel and acacia honey alongside tangy acidity and a hint of hazelnut. Showing the heat of the vintage, this is a richer expression than usual, but bright acidity lifts the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valenti 2017 Contrada Santo Spirito Enrico IV  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, elderflower and crushed tomato vine lead the nose. Crisp and tangy, the racy palate offers juicy grapefruit, green melon and a briny note of sea salt alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2019 Vigna di Mandranova Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Racy and mineral driven, this opens with delicate but enticing scents of white spring blossom, orchard fruit and citrus. The chiseled, tangy palate features ripe pear, green melon and Meyer lemon, while crisp acidity and mineral notes give great energy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2019 Buonora Carricante (Sicilia)

Description: Lightly scented, this opens with delicate aromas evoking beeswax, white stone fruit and field flower. Reflecting the nose, the racy palate offers juicy citrus, yellow apple and saline before a lemon drop candy close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone di Villagrande 2018 Superiore  (Etna)

Description: Fragrant white wildflowers, citrus and a yeasty whiff of bread dough waft out of the glass. Crisp and linear, the racy palate offers yellow apple and grapefruit before closing on notes suggesting white almond and saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cottanera 2018  Etna

Description: Mediterranean scrub, honeydew and citrus aromas lift out of the glass on this savory white. On the refreshing palate, bright acidity underscores wild herbs, grapefruit and green melon alongside tangy saline notes. A hint of white almond lingers on the close.
