Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2019 Sur Sur Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied and lively textured wine offers floral aromas and tantalizing peach flavors that are nicely concentrated and deep. Aged on the lees, it shows there's more to Amador than big reds.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Amador Cellars 2019 Breitmeyer Vineyards Fiano (Amador County)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, tropical fruit and Mediterranean herbs are front and center on this fragrant white. Crisp and savory, the tangy palate features pineapple, grapefruit and ripe yellow apple alongside a mineral vein of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2019 Shamaris Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of oak, cedar and Mediterranean brush mingle with citrus notes. Light bodied and racy, the linear palate offers coconut, toasted hazelnut, Meyer lemon and the barest hint of butterscotch before a tangy ginger finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Graci 2018 Arcuria  (Etna)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: The perfumed nose is loaded with lychee, pear and peach aromas. The round palate combines similar fruit tones with accents of flowers and ripe apple. This is a fruit driven and charming white, with sunny acidity and a long, lingering finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Maris 2018 Made with Organic Grapes Vermentino (Vin de France)

Description: Lightly scented, this polished white opens with delicate aromas of spring blossom and white stone fruit. Made with organically farmed grapes, the bright, savory palate evokes apple and pear alongside tangy minerality and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2019 Fornelli Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: This is a fresh, citrus-driven wine, with crisp acidity and a fine balance between lemon fruitiness, tension and vibrant acidity. The wine is ready to drink but does have the potential to age further.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Domaine Vetriccie Vermentino (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: Lightly scented, this polished white opens with delicate aromas of spring blossom and white stone fruit. Made with organically farmed grapes, the bright, savory palate evokes apple and pear alongside tangy minerality and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2019 Fornelli Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: Delicate scents evoking yellow spring flowers, acacia honey and citrus lift out of the glass. Fresh and polished, the elegant palate doles out mature yellow apple, bread crust and tangerine slice alongside silky bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Metodo Classico Brut Sosta Tre Santi
Name: Nicosia 2017 Metodo Classico Brut Sosta Tre Santi Carricante (Sicilia)

Description: Spanish broom, green melon and honey aromas lead the nose. Made with grapes from extremely old vines, the palate features ripe pear, lemon drop candy and tangy saline before a white almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2019 Archineri  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of white stone fruit, hawthorn and sea breeze lift out of the glass on this crisp, elegant white. The tangy, savory palate features ripe pear, yellow apple and Mediterranean herbs before notes of citrus and saline close the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Maccari 2019 Olli Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This fragrant, refined white opens with aromas suggesting citrus and summer orchard fruit along with an inviting whiff of freshly made bread dough. Dry and savory, the vibrant palate offers mature pear, grapefruit and crushed wild herbs before a crisp, saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2019 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Heady scents of yellow spring flower, lychee and Mediterranean scrub mingle together on this delicately fragrant white. On the racy, linear palate, notes of saline and almond accompany Meyer lemon and yellow apple.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2018 Contrada Rinazzo  (Etna)

Description: Mediterranean brush and yellow spring flower aromas mingle with the barest hint of smoke and a yeasty whiff of bread crust. Linear and medium bodied, the palate features mature lemon rind, ripe yellow apple and toasted almond before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Calabretta 2019 Carricante (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Grapefruit, white rose and botanical herb aromas almost jump out of the glass. The aromas march on to the tangy palate along with ripe apricot and peach. Bright acidity keeps it crisp, while a hint of saline marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2019 Timpa Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Vermentino is the go-to grape in Corsica and this is typical of the soft, white-fruit flavored wines it produces. There are some intriguing additions such as touches of yellow fruit and a zesty mineral texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Domaine Petroni Vermentino (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: Inviting aromas of broom, white stone fruit, Mediterranean herbs and freshly made bread dough form the delicate nose. The bright palate offers ripe green melon, white peach and a hint of white almond alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2019 Bellifolli Insolia (Sicilia)

Description: Spring blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of almond lead the nose. On the crisp, savory palate, bright acidity offsets yellow apple, juicy grapefruit and tangy saline before closing on a hint of fennel seed.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2019 Organic Coste e Preola Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and tropical fruit lead the nose. On the bright, savory palate, tangy saline accompanies grapefruit, juicy pineapple and green melon before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2019 Lucido Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: White rose, citrus and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the nose on this vibrant white. The aromas carry on to the savory, tangy palate along with grapefruit and crushed thyme.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2019 Masso Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: White spring blossom and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose on this crisp, refreshing white. Made with organically farmed Grillo, the tangy palate offers pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of saline alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Mura 2019 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Rich aromas of drawn butter and yellow plum carry to the rounded palate. With a portion of this fermented in oak, the warm spice tones stick out, but stone fruit and citrus accents lend balance.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2018 Scariazzo Fiano (Puglia)

Description: Aromas evoking elderflower, tropical fruit and botanical herb lead the nose. On the fun, light-bodied palate, tangy acidity accompanies grapefruit and mango before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2019 Midor Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Fragrant and refreshing, this has intense aromas of white spring flowers and tropical fruit. On the palate, tangy acidity accompanies passion fruit, honeydew and a dollop of vanilla before a green apple close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2019 Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of smoke, lemon peel and green melon rind carry the nose. The palate is rather silken in feel, with a grip of yellow-plum skin and lemon melding with a stuck flint tone. Tangy plum skins linger on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Produttori di Manduria 2019 Zìn Fiano (Salento)

Description: Delicately scented, this has light aromas evoking Mediterranean herb, citrus and hawthorn. Savory and refreshing, the vibrant palate features ripe white stone fruit, Meyer lemon and saline notes alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2019 Viviri Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of white spring flowers and tropical fruit lead the nose on this refreshing white. The crisp palate doles out pineapple, green melon and Meyer lemon alongside a tangy saline note suggesting oyster shell.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2019 La Segreta Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Spanish broom, white stone fruit and honeydew aromas lead the nose. Racy and linear, the tangy palate offers white grapefruit, green melon and white almond alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2019 Benedè Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, grapefruit and ripe white stone fruit lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the tangy palate offers the same grapefruit sensation carried over from the nose along with ripe yellow pear, lemon drop candy and a hint of fennel.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicosia 2017 Lenza di Munti  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit, tropical fruit and white spring blossoms virtually burst out of the glass. The tangy palate shows a bit more restraint, offering juicy pineapple, Meyer lemon and honeydew alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gergenti 2019 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Lean and linear, this fresh white has a shy nose that eventually reveals scents of white stone fruit and Mediterranean scrub. On the tangy, straightforward palate, bright acidity accompanies suggestions of yellow apple before a briny saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2019 Zagra Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of struck flint, yellow blossoms and plum grace the nose. The palate carries a taut, stony texture that extends flavors of banana and stone fruit, with a slight grip of astringency on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vespa 2019 Il Bianco dei Vespa Fiano (Salento)

Description: Delicate scents evoking yellow spring flowers, white stone fruit and toasted nuts waft out of the glass. On the light-bodied palate, racy acidity accompanies Meyer lemon, peach and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2018 Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas evoking white spring flowers and pear follow over to the bright palate along with suggestions of apple and a hint of almond. It's straightforward and refreshing.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Stemmari 2019 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas suggesting grapefruit and green melon follow over to the palate along with hints of lemon drop candy. Tangy acidity keeps it bright.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fina 2019 Kebrilla Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Made with Carricante, this has surprisingly Sauvignon-like aromas evoking grapefruit, crushed tomato vine and wild herbs. The linear palate is on the lean side, offering Meyer lemon and a hint of saline alongside racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vivera 2016 Salisire Contrada Martinella  (Etna)

Description: This has subtle aromas suggesting tropical fruit and a whiff of medicinal herb. The aromas carry over to the light-bodied palate along with citrus and racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Principi di Butera 2019 Diamante Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this simple white has aromas of wisteria and tropical fruit. It's bright and easygoing, offering grapefruit and green melon alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caruso & Minini 2019 Naturalmente Bio Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas evoking cellar floor, honey and medicinal herbs form the subdued nose. The lean palate offers mere suggestions of lemon and bitter almond alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colosi 2019 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of yellow plum and citrus zest carry the straightforward nose. The palate is sour in nature, with searing acidity carrying flavors of underripe stone fruit and lemon pith.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Coppi 2019 Guiscardo Falanghina (Puglia)

Description: A very quiet nose eventually reveals tones of crushed pills and ramps with time in the glass. The palate is quite neutral in flavor, only showing a hint of lemon and some bitter yeast tone. It ends with some alcoholic burn.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2018 Giancòla Malvasia Bianca (Salento)

Appellation: Prosecco di Valdobbiadene Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: It may a mouthful to pronounce, but once you score a bottle, it's so worth it. It opens with delicate but alluring scents of white spring flowers and orchard fruit, but it's the palate that steals the show. Boasting green apple, ripe pear and creamy white peach, it's bone-dry, with crisp acidity and a white almond close. An elegantly foaming mousse provides finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Rive San Pietro di Barbozza Grande Cuvée del Fondatore Motus Vitae Brut
Name: Bortolomiol 2018 Rive San Pietro di Barbozza Grande Cuvée del Fondatore Motus Vitae Brut  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene Superiore)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Proprietor Jason Haas continually reveals the magic potential of this grape for a warmer weather region like Paso Robles. In this vintage, crisp and light aromas of pear, lemon and lily lead into a fascinating palate of nectarine, honeysuckle and ripe melon, all wrapped in an immensely chalky structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tablas Creek 2019 Vermentino (Adelaida District)

Description: Delicious, crisp and showing a great depth of flavor, this white from the slopes of Mount Etna doles out juicy yellow apple, peach, wild herb and savory, almost salty, mineral notes. Made with Carricante and 10% Riesling, it has racy acidity, energy and captivating mineral tension before finishing on mouthwatering notes of honeyed lemon drop candy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 Eruzione 1614  (Etna)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas of wild herb, yellow flowers and stone fruit shape the delicate nose. The bright, focused palate delivers mature Bartlett pear, juicy Meyer lemon and tangy saline alongside fresh acidity. A hazelnut note lingers on the linear close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Studi Morandi  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Yellow spring flowers, apricot and crushed botanical herb waft out of the glass on this savory white, along with yeasty, inviting whiffs of fresh bread dough. The enveloping, medium-bodied palate picks up where the nose left off, delivering ripe pear, unsweetened lemon drop candy, saline and white almond alongside tangy acidity. A fennel note lingers on the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Raccaro 2018 Rolat Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of acacia honey, chamomile, almond and bread crust carry over to the palate along with dried apricot and lemon drop candy. Accents of smoky flint and saline linger on the finish                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Studi Arianiello  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Showing structure and depth, this opens with aromas of hazelnut, freshly baked bread and ripe yellow apple with a whiff of yellow spring flowers. Rounded and elegant, the dry, enveloping palate features yellow pear, almond, unsweetened lemon drop candy and flinty mineral alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Studi Nassano  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Full bodied and loaded with finesse and flavor, this opens with inviting aromas evoking Spanish broom, crushed herb and mature white stone fruit along with a whiff of bread dough. The full-bodied, savory palate has the structure of a red wine along with a weightless finesse, delivering ripe yellow apple, white pepper, fennel and lemon thyme before a tangy mineral finish suggesting saline. Crisp acidity keeps it vibrant and focused. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Raccaro 2018 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Made with organically farmed Vitovska, a native grape grown in Friuli's Carso denomination, this racy white offers aromas of ripe apple, lemon thyme and wet stone along with a whiff of fresh honey. Racy and focused, the dry palate delivers Bartlett pear, white peach, unsweetened lemon drop candy and savory mineral set against vibrant acidity. Great tension.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castelvecchio 2019 Vitovska (Carso)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Ripe yellow stone fruit, honey and hazelnut aromas lift out of the glass. The enveloping palate features mature apricot, yellow pear, lemon drop candy and smoky mineral before a honeyed close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Studi Sacconi  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the vineyard grafted to Vermentino in 2017, this wine shows how wise it was to try such a variety in this hot appellation while being beautifully floral in lemon peel. Grip and texture present along a steely, high-toned palate of green apple.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Joseph Jewell 2019 Raymond Burr Vineyard Vermentino (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Floral aromas of Spanish broom mingle with Mediterranean scrub and yellow stone fruit on this delicious white. Made with native grape Pallagrello, the savory, medium-bodied palate has a smooth, enveloping structure, featuring ripe apricot, yellow pear and Meyer lemon before a tangy mineral finish evoking saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigne Chigi 2019 Pallagrello Bianco (Terre del Volturno)

Description: Hawthorne and white stone fruit aromas mingle with whiffs of wild herb on the savory white. On the medium-bodied palate, crisp acidity accompanies ripe Bartlett pear, yellow apple and tangy citrus before an almond and saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Selva Capuzza 2019 Selva  (Lugana)

Description: Delicious and vibrant, this medium-bodied white has aromas of white and yellow stone fruit, honey and a hint of nut. On the savory palate, bright acidity lifts ripe yellow pear, crushed mint and ginger before finishing on a bitter almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Spessa 2018 Rassauer Friulano (Collio)

Description: Tropical fruit and yellow spring flower aromas fill the glass. Juicy and savory, the medium-bodied palate offers ripe pear, white peach and Meyer lemon before a saline-mineral and almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Di Meo 2019 G  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Made with small additions of Riesling and Friulano, this elegant white has enticing aromas of spring blossoms, yellow stone fruit and a light whiff of toasted nut. Racy and linear, the crisp, savory palate delivers honeydew, yellow peach and a tangy mineral note alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jermann 2019 Vinnae Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Inviting aromas of grapefruit, hay, white stone fruit and thyme lead the nose. The aromas carry on to the savory, elegant palate along with yellow pear and tangy saline. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced and tense.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Primosic 2019 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Enticing scents of botanical herb, wet stone, geranium and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. Savory and fresh, the focused palate doles out ripe pear, apple and lemon thyme before a tangy, flinty mineral finish. It's made with organically farmed grapes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castelvecchio 2019 Malvasia (Carso)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is a new variety within the state, and what a debut. All fermented in neutral oak, fresh aromas of pear, tangerine, mineral, citrus and flower yield exquisitely pure flavors, with high-wire lemony acidity connecting it all together. A gorgeous wine, its sense of vibrancy separates it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Ago 2019 Cor Estate Vineyard Tocai Friulano (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Aromas of hazelnut, acacia flower, honey and white stone fruit shape the nose on this elegant white. On the savory, focused palate, bright acidity accompanies mature Bartlett pear, botanical herb and a hint of graphite before an almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiopetto 2018 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This radiant white opens with heady aromas of spring blossoms, pear, exotic fruits and a delicate whisper of Mediterranean scrub. It's smooth and savory, featuring Rennet apple, white peach and Meyer lemon alongside crisp acidity. A saline note further energizes the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Di Meo 2018 G  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is a new variety within the state, and what a debut. All fermented in neutral oak, fresh aromas of pear, tangerine, mineral, citrus and flower yield exquisitely pure flavors, with high-wire lemony acidity connecting it all together. A gorgeous wine, its sense of vibrancy separates it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Ago 2019 Cor Estate Vineyard Tocai Friulano (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Mediterranean herb, white stone fruit and citrus aromas mingle with a whiff of wet stone. Linear and racy, the chiseled palate shows Bartlett pear, Meyer lemon and hazelnut alongside vibrant acidity. A flinty mineral further energizes the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Raiano 2018 Satrano  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Eucalyptus, citrus and freshly baked bread aromas waft out of the glass. It's tangy, savory and elegant, featuring flavors of green melon, Meyer lemon, saline and wild herb set against racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2018 Vigna Serrone  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Fresh and medium bodied, this has delicate scents of white stone fruit and spring flowers. On the juicy palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe pear, apple, white peach and fennel before finishing on a tangy mineral note suggesting oyster shell.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Conti Formentini 2019 Raiante Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: A slightly hazy hue of burnt orange, this natural-leaning white offers a playful nose of peach and apricot juice, alongside lifted elements of orange and dried spring flowers. It's tangy and grippy on the palate, showing lots of fruit skin flavors that are filled out by a vein of juicy acidity. A smoky oolong tea note extends on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua 2018 Cosi Comé Greco (Puglia)

Description: Fresh and medium bodied, this has delicate scents of white stone fruit and spring flowers. On the juicy palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe pear, apple, white peach and fennel before finishing on a tangy mineral note suggesting oyster shell.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Conti Formentini 2019 Raiante Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Spring blossom and white stone fruit aromas form the delicate nose along with a whiff of wet stone. Racy and focused, the palate delivers ripe yellow pear, hazelnut, citrus and smoky flint alongside bright acidity and mineral tension.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Di Meo 2018 F  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Acacia flower, yellow peach, pear and citrus aromas mingle together. Tangy and linear, the palate offers apricot, honey, hazelnut and a lemon drop candy note alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Di Meo 2019 F  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly dark shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling of a grape that's rare in California shows aromas of lemon peel, beeswax and toasted nuts. The texture is rich and waxy on the palate, where orange-peel, yellow-apple and more toasted nut flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Villa Creek 2017 Luna Matta Vineyard Fiano (Adelaida District)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, Alpine herb and wet stone shape the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the medium-bodied, rounded palate offers peach, yellow apple and mature grapefruit before a flinty finish. Tangy acidity keeps it juicy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2019 Malvasia (Collio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Wild herb, mature white stone fruit and citrus aromas come together in the glass along with the barest whiffs of exotic fruit and just baked bread. Racy and refined, the linear palate doles out Meyer lemon, green melon and saline alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2018 Vigna Ortale  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Aromas of mature pear, citrus and white spring flowers form the delicately enticing nose. The savory palate offers gooseberry, white peach and juicy grapefruit alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a white almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà dei Frati 2019 I Frati  (Lugana)

Description: Delicate aromas of spring field flowers and white stone fruit form the nose along with whiffs of chamomile and nut. Reflecting the aromas, the round palate offers ripe Bartlett pear, yellow apple and a hint of grapefruit alongside tangy acidity. A bitter almond note signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Venica & Venica 2019 Primarul Friulano (Collio)

Description: Mature yellow stone fruit, toasted hazelnut and dried herb aromas lead the nose along with a whiff of honey. The round, enveloping palate offers ripe yellow peach and lemon drop candy before a honeyed almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Morette 2017 Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Subtle aromas of spring blossoms and yellow stone fruit escape the glass. On the enveloping, medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe peach, apricot and tangy lemon drop candy before closing on a savory saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetto 2017 Recorbian  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of spring blossoms and white stone fruit form the nose along with a whiff of cantaloupe. Linear and racy, the palate offers ripe pear, lemon drop candy and a hint of hazelnut alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2018 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, spring wildflower and Alpine herb lead the nose. Elegant and linear, the vibrant, savory palate offers yellow peach, apricot and a hint of graphite alongside bright acidity. It closes on an almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgo Conventi 2018 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of yellow apple, spring blossoms and grapefruit form the delicate nose. The aromas follow over to the savory, structured palate along with lemon drop candy, orange zest and a hint of ginger. Vibrant acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Livon 2018 Manditocai Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of bread crust and white stone form the inviting nose. On the bright, savory palate, tangy acidity accompanies ripe yellow apple, creamy Bartlett pear and hazelnut alongside an elegant perlage and fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Selva Capuzza NV Metodo Classico Brut Hirundo  (Lugana)

Description: Lovely aromas of white spring flowers mingle with pear and a whiff of freshly baked bread. Racy and elegant, the savory palate offers ripe apple, white peach and citrusy notes alongside vibrant acidity. It has a crisp, pristine close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zuani 2018 Sodevo Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Rich aromas of melon and apple meld with white blossoms on the nose. This is playful and fruity on the palate in juicy tones of apricot skins and pineapple, while a gentle grip of white tea and tangy acidity keep it all buttoned up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2019 Askos Verdeca (Salento)

Description: Yellow spring flower, Meyer lemon and white stone fruit aromas form the delicate nose along with a whiff of thyme. On the savory, vibrant palate, hazelnut and bread dough notes accent ripe yellow pear and white peach before a tangy mineral close suggesting briny oyster shell.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiopetto 2018 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Lightly scented, this opens with whiffs of toasted hazelnut, beeswax and yellow apple. On the palate, hints of bitter almond and a dollop of vanilla accent ripe pear and white peach. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Selva Capuzza 2016 Menasso Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of mature yellow stone fruit, grapefruit and beeswax mingle together in the glass. Mirroring the nose, the medium-bodied, savory palate features ripe apricot, peach and hazelnut before finishing on a honeyed note. Fresh acidity accompanies the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigna del Lauro 2019 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Hawthorn, hay and tomato leaf mingle with citrus aromas on this inviting, medium-bodied white. On the savory palate, notes of thyme, sage and fennel accent ripe yellow pear and lemon drop candy before a honeyed almond close. Fresh acidity keeps it bright and focused.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Conti Formentini 2019 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A relative of Sauvignon Blanc, this unusual grape has lovely floral highlights and plenty of tart citrus. The crunchy apple fruit is paired with tangy tangerine, and it adds up to a refreshing, acid-driven alternative to the more standard Willamette Valley whites.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cooper Mountain 2019 Tocai Friulano (Willamette Valley)

Description: Enticing scents of spring blossoms, white stone fruit and citrus shape the delicate nose. Made with organic grapes, it's fresh, savory and understated, offering ripe yellow pear, grapefruit and bitter almond alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Perla del Garda 2019 Organic  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of hay and tropical fruit mix with whiffs of elderflower and crushed tomato leaf. On the racy palate, crisp acidity accompanies juicy grapefruit, green melon and wild herb before a clean, dry close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2018 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Enticing scents of yellow stone fruit, geranium and citrus form the delicate, alluring nose. On the savory, focused palate, racy acidity and energizing mineral accompany tangerine, lime zest and saline before a white almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2019 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Spring wildflower and white stone fruit aromas form the delicate, alluring nose. On the bright, tangy palate, fresh acidity accompanies yellow apple and white peach before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Selva Capuzza 2019 San Vigilio  (Lugana)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of spring wildflowers and yellow stone fruit shape the nose along with a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. Crisp and savory, the racy palate offers yellow apple, Meyer lemon and tangy mineral notes evoking saline and briny oyster shell.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2019  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas suggesting spring blossoms, white stone fruits and Mediterranean brush shape the nose along with a whiff of bread dough. Elegant and racy, the chiseled palate offers yellow pear, lemon thyme and briny oyster shell alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2018 Vigna Laure  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit and graphite interlace on the nose of this wine. On the savory, medium-bodied palate, a hint of honey accents ripe pear and bitter almond set against tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ponca 2018 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Fermented and aged in Slavonian oak, this fragrant, amber-colored wine opens with aromas of graphite, cedar, dried yellow stone fruit and saffron. The understated, structured palate shows elegance and restraint, featuring dried apricot, orange zest, saline and a sprinkling of ginger before a honeyed almond close. Fans of orange wine will love it.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Primosic 2016 Ribolla di Oslavia Riserva Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Lightly scented, this opens with delicate aromas of spring field flowers and white stone fruit. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity accompanies ripe yellow pear, white peach and a hint of ginger.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2019 Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Aromas of honey, acacia and cedar form the nose together with a whiff of summer orchard fruit. The racy, linear palate features mature yellow apple and toasted hazelnut alongside vibrant acidity. It closes on a tangy saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2016 Collio Friulano (Collio)

Description: Yellow spring wildflower, botanical herb and white stone fruit aromas lead the nose. On the racy palate, crisp acidity accompanies yellow apple and unsweetened lemon drop candy before closing on a hint of white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Rajade 2018 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This racy white has aromas reminiscent of exotic fruit, Mediterranean brush and citrus zest. On the crisp, linear palate, brisk acidity accompanies Bartlett pear, Meyer lemon and notes suggesting honeyed nut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2019  Fiano di Avellino

Description: Spring blossom, yellow apple and hazelnut aromas waft out of the glass. The aromas carry on to the vibrant, focused palate alongside yellow pear and a hint of Meyer lemon. It's crisp, with racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2018 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Graphite, acacia, hazelnut and honey aromas follow over to the focused palate together with ripe apricot, bitter almond and a hint of grapefruit. Vibrant acidity provides the setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Rajade 2018 Friulano (Collio)

Description: A hazy color of sunset orange, this lively white starts off on aromas of apple, peach and tangerine, with blossomy white flowers joining in. It's tangy and racy on the palate, with textural flavors of apple and apricot skins that are elongated by a lingering oolong tea sensation. This is a great hands-off expression of the boisterous Bombino variety.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua 2018 Lux Bombino (Puglia)

Description: Linear and vibrant, this has delicate aromas of beeswax and hazelnut with a whiff of honey. On the racy, understated palate, smoky mineral accents Meyer lemon and yellow apple before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monterosso 2017 Crater  (Etna)

Description: Subtle scents of beeswax and acacia flower shape the nose along with a whiff of honey. The aromas carry on to the palate along with ripe pear and white almond, all set against tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pratello 2019 Catulliano  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit, hay and toasted nut shape the subtle nose. It racy and linear, offering yellow apple, spearmint, citrus zest and hazelnut alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà dei Frati 2018 Brolettino  (Lugana)

Description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas lead the way on this bright, tangy white from the shores of Lake Garda. The juicy palate offers white peach and green melon before a white almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Perla del Garda 2019 Perla  (Lugana)

Description: Botanical herb, hazelnut and ripe exotic fruit aromas form the nose. On the full-bodied palate, fennel, thyme and evident alcohol accompany dried apricot before an almost salty mineral close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ponca 2018 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Lightly scented, this has aromas of yellow flowers, yellow stone fruit and citrus. The aromas follow on to the crisp palate along with lemon drop candy and bitter almond. Lively acidity keeps bright and fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Cicogna 2018 S. Caterina  (Lugana)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this offers alluring aromas of spring blossoms and white stone fruit with a whiff of nut. It's fresh and tangy, with pear and green melon flavors before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pasini San Giovanni 2019 Il Lugana  (Lugana)

Description: Botanical herb, hazelnut and ripe exotic fruit aromas form the nose. On the full-bodied palate, fennel, thyme and evident alcohol accompany dried apricot before an almost salty mineral close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ponca 2018 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Lightly scented, this has aromas of white stone fruit and spring blossoms with a whiff of grilled herb. It's crisp and light bodied, evoking flavors of white peach and green melon alongside racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Perla del Garda 2019 Ora  (Lugana)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Boisterous tones of white blossoms, candied citrus peels and Gala apple give this fruity white a sense of ease. While the fruit comes in full blast on the palate, there's still plenty of tension holding it all in check. This is a playful, crowd-pleasing white that could easily be enjoyed as an aperitivo.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2019 Marese Bombino Bianco (Castel del Monte)

Description: White spring flower and orchard fruit aromas lift out of the glass. The bright palate doles out apricot, banana and a hint of pineapple alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Di Meo 2019 S Falanghina (Campania)

Description: This has floral and fruity aromas of hawthorn and exotic fruit. On the lively palate, bright acidity accompanies yellow pear, honeydew and white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Menegotti 2019  Lugana

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Beeswax, eucalyptus and white stone fruit aromas emerge from the glass. Crisp and savory, the tangy palate offers green melon, pear and lemon zest alongside vibrant acidity. It closes on a bitter almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Claudio Quarta 2019 Cantina Sanpaolo  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and banana are front and center. The banana note carries on to the racy palate along with green melon and Granny Smith apple set against crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sturm 2019 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Heady scents evoking spring blossoms and summer orchard fruit waft out of the glass along with a whiff of wild herb. The lean, linear palate suggests apple, citrus and a dollop of acacia honey alongside a backbone of racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ponca 2018 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: A divisive expression of Verdeca, this white sees extended time on its skins to yield a straw-yellow color, with burnt orange highlights. It's rife with herbal aromas of wild spearmint and elderflower alongside rich elements of lemon oil and oolong tea. The palate is bright and lifted in tones of crushed mint and apricot skins. It's grippy in feel yet fresh and utterly idiosyncratic.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Polvanera 2018 Verdeca (Puglia)

Description: Lightly scented, this tangy white has delicate aromas of green melon and white spring flowers. It's fresh and easygoing, offering ripe pear, tropical fruit and a citrus note alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Aldegheri 2019 Le Querce  (Lugana)

Description: This natural-leaning wine is a bit dichotomous. The nose starts off on rich aromas of citrus oil, drawn butter, smoke and walnut skin, while the palate is more tense and mineral driven. Crushed stone and steely lemon flavors are energetic and lifted, while drying tannins lend grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua 2018 Bombino (Puglia)

Description: This has aromas of honeysuckle and tropical fruit with a whiff of hay. On the rounded palate, tangy acidity accompanies passion fruit and banana before closing on a note of bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villabella 2019  Lugana

Description: Oak, toasted hazelnut and graphite aromas slowly take shape in the glass. The aromas follow over to the amber-hued palate along with vanilla and butterscotch before a bitter almond close. It's medium bodied but lacks fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Primosic 2016 Skin Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. The fresh, tangy palate offers mature white peach and honeydew before closing on a note of bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lenotti 2019  Soave Classico

Description: Tangy and fresh, this has aromas of white spring flowers and tropical fruit. The bright palate offers honeydew and citrus alongside vibrant acidity before a lemon drop candy close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santa Sofia 2019  Lugana

Description: Lively aromas of papaya, melon and lemon start off this fruity number. It's well balanced and juicy on the palate, with a soft curve of melon against a sharper streak of lemon peel. “Alice” means anchovy in Italian, and this zesty white could be a perfect match alongside some fresh seafood.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Produttori di Manduria 2019 Alice Verdeca (Salento)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas suggesting medicinal herb and citrus lead the nose. On the racy, linear palate, firm acidity accompanies Meyer lemon, pear and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2018 Linea Stemma  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This vibrant white has subtle aromas suggesting botanical herb, citrus and acacia honey. The honeyed note follows over to the lean, racy palate along with hints of pear, lemon and bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2019 Linea Stemma  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit, elderflower and tropical fruit jump out of the glass. The grapefruit note carries over to the tangy palate along with ripe green melon and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Seiterre 2019  Lugana

Description: This simple white has subtle aromas of honeysuckle and passion fruit. The fruity palate mirrors the nose, offering tropical fruit and honeydew alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a bitter almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Zovo 2019 Le Civaie  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas suggesting ripe pear and exotic fruit shape the delicate nose. Mirroring the nose, the simple palate offers yellow apple and honeydew accompanied by lively acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tommasi 2019 Il Fornaci  (Lugana)

Description: Very dry and tangy, this light-bodied wine offers fresh herb aromas and nervy, veggie flavors. It makes a refreshing change from heavy, rich whites.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fasi Estate 2019 Malvasia Bianca (California)

Description: This lean and tangy wine offers plenty of crisp apple flavors, good acidity and light body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peltier 2019 Estate Grown Vermentino (Lodi)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and honeysuckle lead the nose. On the fresh, simple palate, bright acidity accompanies pear, honeydew and pineapple.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terre d'Aione 2019  Fiano di Avellino

Description: The shy nose doesn't give much away, while the informal, rather diluted palate suggests citrus and pear. It closes on a bitter note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Girardi 2019  Lugana

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: White spring flower and exotic fruit aromas take center stage on this informal white. The simple palate offers suggestions of pineapple and green melon alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terre d'Aione 2019  Greco di Tufo

Description: Radiant and loaded with finesse, this lovely sparkler opens with floral and fruit aromas of hawthorn, acacia and yellow pear. The bone-dry, linear palate delivers mature green apple, white peach and a savory mineral note alongside a foaming mousse. Bright acidity keeps it balanced and energized.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: De Stefani NV Rive di Refrontolo Brut Nature  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Hawthorn, acacia, wild herb and white stone fruit aromas lift out of the glass. Racy and refined, the savory palate doles out creamy white peach, yellow pear and lemon slice, alongside tangy acidity, while a foaming mousse lends finesse. It closes on a white almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Manzane 2018 Manzane 20.10 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Elegant and savory, this linear white offers delicate scents of spring blossom and yellow stone fruit along with a whiff of citrus. The crisp palate boasts tension and energy, offering yellow pear, apricot, Meyer lemon and tangy mineral notes of saline alongside racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: From decades-old vines planted in 1974, this is a light, bright and nicely layered white wine, rare for these parts, that tastes of stony mineral, lemon and lime. Crisp acidity rides beneath the lushness, finding complementary balance and refreshment.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lola 2018 Malvasia Bianca (St. Helena)

Description: Elegant and structured, this opens with delicate, alluring scents of yellow stone fruit, citrus, Spanish broom and Mediterranean herb. The full-bodied palate boasts freshness and finesse, delivering yellow peach, apricot, Meyer lemon and saline before a lingering honeyed almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 Cometa Fiano (Sicilia)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange-blossom reduction, key lime, daffodil and tuberose aromas make for an almost gin-like expression on the exotically floral nose of this bottling. The wine lands briskly and bone dry on the palate, where rounded white-peach and orange-blossom-water flavors converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Larner 2018 Malvasia Bianca (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight aromas of pomelo pith, honeydew and orange blossom make a tonic-like display on the nose of this bottling. There's a ton of sizzle to the lively sip, where energetic flavors of orange blossom and quinine make for an intriguing quaff.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Refugio Ranch 2019 Malvasia Bianca (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Delicately enticing scents of spring wildflower, white stone fruit and beeswax mingle together on this crisp, elegant white. It's linear, balanced and loaded with finesse, delivering ripe yellow pear, lemon zest, Mediterranean herb and saline alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pietradolce 2018 Archiner Biancoi  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of fragrant spring flower and white orchard fruit form the delicately enticing nose. Dry and savory, the vibrant palate shows crunchy apple, Anjou pear and a hint of green melon alongside crisp acidity. Foaming bubbles soften the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Malibràn 2018 5 Grammi Extra Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Troon's transition to new varieties and biodynamic vineyard practices is on full display here. Noninterventionist winemaking starts with hand-harvesting, foot-crushing, native yeasts and no additions to the ferment. The complex, textural result is this detailed white wine, with clover, lemon rind, fresh apple and wet straw flavors among many nuanced highlights. It's subtle and expressive. Drink now through the early 2020s.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Troon 2018 Estate Bottled Kubli Bench Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

Description: Aromas of white and yellow stone fruit mix with floral scents of white spring blossom. Tangy and polished, the softly sparkling palate delivers mature yellow apple, ripe Anjou pear and lemon zest alongside crisp acidity. An almond note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Vigneto Giardino Rive di Colbertaldo Asciutto
Name: Adami 2018 Vigneto Giardino Rive di Colbertaldo Asciutto  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This opens with heady scents of honeysuckle and tropical fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean brush. The racy, refreshing palate doles out yellow peach, pineapple and grapefruit alongside a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2018 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Enticing floral aromas of wisteria and hawthorn mingle with white peach. On the creamy palate, a polished mousse wraps around Granny Smith apple, green melon and candied citrus notes alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Andreola 2018 Dirupo Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The barrel effect is apparent on the oaky nose of this bottling, which is Chardonnay-like with apple syrup, pineapple guava and Ruby Red grapefruit flavors. The palate is more compelling and quite agreeable, with savory sea-salt, dried lemon-peel and Asian pear flesh flavors that rise through the toasty oak.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Hall 2018 Cavern Select Vermentino (Paso Robles)

Description: This fragrant sparkler opens with aromas of spring blossom and mature white stone fruit. On the creamy palate, bright acidity lifts mature yellow apple, ripe Bartlett pear and citrus drop candy. It's polished, with a silky mousse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bacio della Luna 2018 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is worth checking out if simply for the novelty of a newer grape variety. The nose begins with crisp aromas of pear flesh and lime peel, leading into a tightly woven palate of tart apple and mandarin orange flavors: quite mellow but very pleasant.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castoro Cellars 2018 Whale Rock Vineyard Falanghina (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of acacia flower and mature yellow apple mingle with whiffs of almond. On the soft palate, a polished mousse accompanies mature pear, glazed almond and lemon drop candy. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Tordera NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: White spring wildflower and ripe pear aromas shape the nose. On the off-dry palate, a soft mousse accompanies mature yellow apple and creamy peach before a lemon drop candy close. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Malibràn 2018 Gorio Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made with native grape Caprettone that was vinified and aged in amphorae, this unusual, amber-colored wine has aromas of dried apricot, honey and toasted nut. The aromas carry on to the rather lean, linear palate along with a smoky mineral note. It's not for everyone, but fans of orange wine will be intrigued.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bosco de' Medici 2017 Dressel 19.2 Caprettone (Pompeiano)

Description: Creamy and fragrant, this has enticing scents of spring blossom, mature pear and crystallized ginger. On the lightly sparkling palate, a polished mousse and crisp acidity accompany baked yellow apple, white peach and lemon drop candy. Crisp acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Drusian NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made with native grape Caprettone that was vinified and aged in amphorae, this unusual, amber-colored wine has aromas of dried apricot, honey and toasted nut. The aromas carry on to the rather lean, linear palate along with a smoky mineral note. It's not for everyone, but fans of orange wine will be intrigued.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bosco de' Medici 2017 Dressel 19.2 Caprettone (Pompeiano)

Description: Creamy and fragrant, this has enticing scents of spring blossom, mature pear and crystallized ginger. On the lightly sparkling palate, a polished mousse and crisp acidity accompany baked yellow apple, white peach and lemon drop candy. Crisp acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Drusian NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow apple, peach and Bartlett pear follow over to the tangy, savory palate along with lemon zest notes. A saline note caps off the finish, while crisp acidity keeps it vibrant.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2018 Nestor  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and white spring wildflower shape the nose. On the crisp palate, bright acidity accompanies pineapple and apricot alongside a hint of wild herbs.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terre Stregate 2018 Svelato  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: Floral and fruity, this has aromas of honeysuckle, Bartlett pear and exotic fruit. On the off-dry palate, a creamy mousse accompanies ripe yellow apple, honeydew and acacia honey.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ciodet 2018 Giosuè Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This enjoyable white has aromas evoking spring flower and citrus with a whiff of exotic fruit. The linear, tangy palate reflects the nose, offering apricot, pineapple and grapefruit notes before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2018 Shamaris Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and Granny Smith apple jump out of the glass. The green apple aroma carries on to the racy palate together with lemon zest and yellow peach. A vibrant perlage provides the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Maschio dei Cavalieri 2018 Rive di Colbertaldo Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Wisteria and Granny Smith apple aromas dominate the fragrant nose. On the off-dry, rather sweet palate, a foaming mousse accompanies ripe yellow pear, lemon drop candy and bitter almond. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Andreola 2018 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Acacia and ripe pear aromas create an inviting nose. Crisp and savory, the palate offers ripe golden apple, peach and lemon drop candy alongside a soft perlage and racy acidity. It closes on an almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta 2 Castelli NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has aromas suggesting white spring flower and white stone fruit. The ripe palate shows mature pear, yellow apple and a hint of mineral alongside a hazelnut note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Sarno 1860 2017  Fiano di Avellino

Description: Rounded aromas of Meyer lemon, lemon verbena, mint and cut grass make for an intriguing entry to the nose of this bottling, which showcases a grape that works well for the region. The palate is clean and crisp with lime-peel and apple-flesh flavors, riding an tense texture that fades by the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wiens Cellars 2018 Vermentino (California)

Description: Aromas of hawthorn and jasmine mingle with scents of white orchard fruit. On the tangy palate, crisp acidity accompanies ripe yellow apple and Meyer lemon before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rossovermiglio 2016 Greco (Sannio)

Description: This refreshing sparkler opens with delicate scents of white spring flower and ripe pear. On the crisp palate, a vibrant perlage accompanies Granny Smith apple and lemon drop candy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: BiancaVigna NV Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: This polished sparkler opens with heady scents of white spring flower and white orchard fruit. The softly foaming palate offers ripe pear, white peach and grapefruit before a lemon drop candy finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà di Rajo 2018 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Green apple and fragrant spring flower aromas lead the nose. The palate delivers ripe pear, Meyer lemon and bitter almond alongside crisp acidity and a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ciodet NV Gelmo Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of wisteria, hawthorn and pear shape the nose along with whiffs of citrus. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity and a foaming mousse provide the background for Granny Smith apple and tangerine drop candy before a white almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Merotto NV Colbelo Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Spring blossom, apricot and tropical fruit aromas shape the nose. On the tangy palate, a soft mousse accompanies yellow peach and ripe pear before a lemon drop candy finish. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zardetto NV Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of hawthorn mingle with a whiff of tropical fruit. The medium-bodied palate suggests lemon zest, dried pineapple and bitter almond before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnachiara 2017 Aletheia  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Heady scents of green apple and honeysuckle lead the nose. The apple aroma follows over to the foaming palate along with white peach and citrus zest. Crisp acidity lifts the white almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Tordera 2018 Brunei Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Subtle aromas of yellow apple, citrus zest and crushed botanical herbs follow over to the dry, racy palate along with mature pear. Vivacious bubbles provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Silvano Follador 2018 Brut Nature  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Floral aromas of wisteria and honeysuckle combine with tropical fruit on this fragrant sparkler. On the racy palate, a vibrant perlage offsets Granny Smith apple and white peach before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta 2 Castelli NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This fragrant, unusual expression of Carricante has vivid aromas of crushed tomato vine, grapefruit and green melon. The aromas carry on the tangy, slightly more subdued palate along with mature yellow apple, pineapple and bright acidity before a slightly honeyed close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vivera 2015 Salire Contrada Martinella Biacno  (Etna)

Description: Scents of white spring wildflower and white stone fruit shape the delicate nose. Softly sparkling and fresh, it offers Granny Smith apple, white peach and white almond before a lemon drop candy close. It's bright, with tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Astoria NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Invigorating aromas of spring wildflower, white stone fruit and citrus form the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the crisp palate offers yellow apple, grapefruit, beeswax and bitter almond alongside a lively perlage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà di Rajo 2018 Cuvée del Fondatore  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This softly foaming sparkler has aromas of green apple, mature pear and citrus. The aromas carry on to the tangy palate along with a note of lemon drop candy and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ciodet NV Labano Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Green apple aromas carry over to the softly foaming palate along with peach and lemon drop candy. Crisp acidity gives it a tangy, refreshing close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Loredan Gasparini NV Brut  (Asolo Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of Granny Smith apple, bitter almond and a confectionary note carry over to the foaming palate along with vanilla and lemon drop candy. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Le Rive di Ogliano Extra Dry
Name: Masottina 2018 Le Rive di Ogliano Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Meyer lemon, oyster shell and wet stone aromas form the nose on this light-bodied white. The tangy, linear palate offers lime, yellow apple and saline along with crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Astroni 2018 Colle Imperatrice Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Description: Spanish broom, butterscotch and citrus zest aromas lead the way along with a medicinal whiff of adhesive bandage. The aromas carry over to the racy palate along with bitter almond, yellow apple skin and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Rive di Carpesica Sei Uno Brut
Name: Bellenda 2016 Rive di Carpesica Sei Uno Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Wisteria and banana aromas shape the nose. On the lightly foaming palate, bright acidity accompanies ripe pear, white peach and a lemon drop candy note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brancher 2018 B Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Softly foaming, this offers yellow apple, candied lemon slice, bitter almond and confectionary flavors. Racy acidity lends verve.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mionetto NV Luxury Collection Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Acacia flower and toasted nut aromas carry on to the palate along with citrus peel and mature yellow apple skin. Bitter walnut marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2017 Ottant'anni Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Wisteria and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity and lively perlage frame white peach and green apple before a candied citrus slice close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta 2 Castelli 2018 Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This mature white offers aromas of ripe yellow apple and acacia honey. The aromas carry over to the palate along with dried apricot and candied lemon zest before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Amarano 2017 Dulcinea  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting yellow spring flower and pear shape the delicate nose. The palate is straightforward and crisp, offering grapefruit and pineapple before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antica Masseria del Sigillo 2018 Fiano (Campania)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this has heady aromas of peach blossom, honeydew and ripe white stone fruit. The crisp, light-bodied palate isn't as expressive as the nose but is still enjoyable, suggesting yellow pear, green melon and lemon zest.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Di Giovanna 2018 Vurria Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and tropical fruit lift out of the glass. On the palate, tangy acidity accompanies honeydew, white grapefruit, lemon drop candy and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fondo Antico 2018 Parlante Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of green melon and honeysuckle form the nose. On the foaming palate, racy acidity brightens Granny Smith apple, bitter almond and a confectionary note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Colture NV Planer Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: The rather shy nose offers aromas of medicinal herb and a hint of plastic. On the vibrant palate, vibrant acidity accompanies apple, citrus, pear and saline alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sorrentino 2018 Benita '31 Caprettone (Vesuvio)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: This has aromas of white spring flower, medicinal herb and green apple. The apple aroma follows over to the crisp palate along with a candied note before a bitter finish. A vivacious perlage provides the setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Marca NV Luminore Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Honeysuckle and ripe pear aromas form the delicate nose. On the bright palate, a foaming mousse and crisp acidity offset mature white peach and a hint of candied citrus drop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terre di Rai 2018 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This fun sparkler has a shy, floral nose, while the foaming palate offers Granny Smith apple, honeydew and a candied note. Crisp acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ruggeri & C. NV Giall'oro Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of white peach and toasted almond form the subtle nose. The vibrant palate offers mature yellow apple and candied citrus slice alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Sant'Anna NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of Granny Smith apple and honeysuckle. The green apple aroma follows over to the off-dry palate, along with honeydew and a candied note set against crisp acidity and lively bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Collalto 2018 Gaio Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Mediterranean scrub, pear and acacia aromas follow on to the simple, tangy palate along with crisp acidity. A candied note marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2018 Nimphis Sacrae Coda di Volpe (Beneventano)

Description: This has aromas suggesting yellow peach and Mediterranean brush. The aromas follow over to the light-bodied palate along with hints of lemon drop candy and thyme before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantine Astroni 2016 Vigna Astroni Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Description: Aromas of ripe pear and bitter almond carry over to the straightforward palate along with a hint of yellow apple skin and a confectionary note. Vivacious bubbles and brisk acidity provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pizzolato NV Stefany Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This simple, off-dry sparkler offers mature yellow apple, bitter almond and a confectionary note alongside a lively perlage. Brisk acidity provides the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Val d'Oca 2018 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Tropical fruit and honeysuckle aromas form the subtle nose. It's simply refreshing, offering suggestions of pineapple and peach alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nativ 2018 Vico Riviera 99 Falanghina (Beneventano)

Description: This has a subdued nose evoking honeysuckle and hawthorn. On the palate, racy acidity and vigorous bubbles offset suggestions of yellow apple, bitter almond and a candied note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Belussi NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Intense floral aromas of lilies past their prime permeate the nose. The aromas carry over to the lean, brisk palate along with tart, freshly squeezed lemon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cortese 2018 Lucido Nostru Catarratto (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This has aromas suggesting overripe orange peel and pressed spring flower. On the simple, lean palate, vigorous acidity accompanies mature yellow apple skin and lemon zest.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Solaria 2018 Kalsa Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This has bitter aromas of adhesive bandage that follow over to the palate along with bitter almond and mature yellow apple skin. Brisk acidity and steely bubbles provide the backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: V8+ NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Chemical aromas suggesting adhesive bandage dominate the nose. The aromas carry over to the lean, bitter palate together with metal, lemon juice and bitter almond alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Vigne di Alice NV Fondo  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of yellow apple and medicinal herbs lead the nose. The brisk palate is bitter and muddled, evoking adhesive bandage, raw almond and chemical notes alongside racy acidity and vivacious bubbles.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa Farive NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, acacia and yellow stone fruit mingle with whiffs of hazelnut on this stunning white. Elegantly structured, the radiant palate has depth and complexity thanks to volcanic soils and 100-year-old vines, delivering apricot, ripe pear and tangy mineral notes evoking oyster shell before a white-almond finish. Hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gini 2016 Contrada Salvarenza Vecchie Vigne  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Inviting aromas of ripe apple, Bartlett pear and white spring flower are front and center on this fragrant white. On the vibrant savory palate, fresh acidity accompanies mature yellow peach, lemon drop and a hint of honeyed almond. A saline note lingers on the tangy finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Studi Chiantelle  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: White spring blossom and yellow stone fruit aromas shape the enticing nose along with whiffs of Mediterranean herb and almond. Linear and medium bodied, the savory palate offers orange zest, mature apricot and Meyer lemon, alongside tangy acidity. A mineral note suggesting briny oyster shell signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2017 Studi Ariella  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Structured, elegant and savory, this wine offers delicate aromas of wild flowers, yellow stone fruit, dried sage and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. Tangy, savory and understated, it evolves continuously in the glass, delivering ripe apricot, yellow pear, Meyer lemon and almond underscored by a tangy saline note. Fresh acidity provides the backbone.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mastroberardino 2017 Stilema  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Aromas of acacia flower, honey and hazelnut meld with whiffs of graphite and mature yellow apple on the nose. The aromas follow over to the savory palate along with lemon zest, yellow pear, fennel and bitter almond. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors while a hint of saline graces the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Inama 2017 Vigneti di Foscarino Vecchie Vigne  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit, honey and smoky notes waft out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the elegant, radiant palate shows apricot, golden apple and a hint of honey alongside smoky flint and bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Raiano 2018 Ventidue  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Citrus zest, Spanish broom, botanical herb and a whiff of smoke emerge from the glass. This wine is structured, elegant and linear, delivering ripe yellow pear, Meyer lemon, hazelnut and flinty mineral alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mastroberardino 2018 Radici  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Elderflower, tropical-fruit and citrus aromas are front and center on this fragrant white. The palate is also expressive, doling out yellow peach, pineapple and Meyer lemon before a mineral-driven saline finish. Bright acidity accompanies the savory flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2019 Cutizzi  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Flinty mineral, smoke, yellow pear, toasted hazelnut and acacia aromas follow over to the elegant medium-bodied palate along with Meyer lemon, mature yellow apple and saline. A note of chestnut honey wraps around the finish while fresh acidity keeps it balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mastroberardino 2016 Stilema  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Spanish broom, acacia, beeswax and mature yellow stone fruit are just some of the aromas you'll find on this intriguing wine. On the rounded, enveloping palate, fresh acidity underscores mature peach, honeyed almond and tangy mineral notes evoking saline. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Balestri Valda 2016 Vigneto Sengialta  (Soave Classico)

Description: Hailing from one of the denomination's most famed vineyard areas, this has gently enticing scents of field flower, lemon drop and wet stone. Reflecting the nose, the linear palate delivers yellow apple, pear, citrus and tangy mineral notes set against bright acidity. A white-almond note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Inama 2017 Vigneti di Carbonare  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and ripe apricot form the nose. On the round, enveloping palate, tangy acidity accompanies ripe yellow peach, dried pineapple and candied lemon drop before finishing on an almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2017 Vigne di Catullo Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this has a deep golden hue and enticing aromas of exotic fruit, spring blossom and wild herb. On the delicious palate, crisp acidity accompanies ripe apricot, yellow apple and peach alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2019 Taburno Greco (Sannio)

Description: White spring flower, white stone fruit and pineapple aromas lift out of the glass along with a whiff of wet stone. On the tangy, delicious palate, bright acidity lifts ripe Bartlett pear, white peach and juicy lemon drop along with a hint of saline. An almond note graces the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marangona 2019  Lugana

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spring blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of wild herb form the nose. Elegantly structured, the fresh, enveloping palate features mature peach, lemon drop and a hint of nutmeg alongside tangy mineral.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2019 Pietracalda  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle but enticing scents of yellow pear, smoke, citrus and hazelnut lift out of the glass along with hints of cedar. The aromas follow through to the elegantly structured palate, together with citrus zest and a hint of acacia honey. Showing the aging potential of Fiano di Avellino, this is a serious white made to accompany an entire meal rather than being poured as an aperitivo.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mastroberardino 2015 More Maiorum  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: White spring blossom, exotic fruit and peach aromas shape the enticing nose. It's savory and medium in weight, doling out Meyer lemon, honeydew melon and ripe yellow apple before a tangy saline finish. Bright acidity lifts the juicy flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mastroberardino 2019 Nova Serra  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Aromas of hawthorn, white stone fruit and spice lead the nose along with whiffs of lemon thyme. It's full bodied and enveloping, offering white peach, tangerine drop and a dollop of vanilla before a white-almond close. Vibrant acidity keeps it bright and fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Morette 2018 Benedictus  (Lugana)

Description: Yellow spring flower, yellow pear, botanical herb and a yeasty whiff of pastry dough come together on this savory white. Refreshing and loaded with finesse, the delicious, linear palate delivers Meyer lemon, golden apple and hazelnut alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2019 Taburno Fiano (Sannio)

Description: Racy and delicious, this refreshing white offers aromas of tropical fruit, spring wild flower and a whiff of dried botanical herb. On the savory palate, vibrant acidity brightens yellow apple, Meyer lemon and tangy saline before closing on a white-almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gini 2018  Soave Classico

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Linear and elegant, this has delicate but enticing aromas of acacia, beeswax, stone fruit and a whiff of honey. The aromas follow through to the racy palate, together with yellow pear, hazelnut and a hint of smoky flint that lends mineral tension. Some may find this too ethereal, while others will be captivated.                      Kerin O’Keefe
