Name: Villa Raiano 2018 Alimata  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Left on its lees for 16 months, this wine is full of character, opening with heady aromas of citrus blossom, white stone fruit and slightly balsamic notes of eucalyptus. On the savory, enveloping palate, tangy acidity lifts mature apricot, lemon drop and golden apple before a honeyed almond close. It has surprising freshness for the hot vintage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Martinelli 2017 Pantagruele  (Soave)

Description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this offers enticing scents of Spanish broom, acacia, stone fruit and honey. The honey note follows on to the enveloping, savory palate along with dried apricot, lemon drop and ginger before a white-almond close. Bright acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Filippi 2018 Vigne della Brà  (Soave Colli Scaligeri)

Description: Left on its lees for 16 months, this wine is full of character, opening with heady aromas of citrus blossom, white stone fruit and slightly balsamic notes of eucalyptus. On the savory, enveloping palate, tangy acidity lifts mature apricot, lemon drop and golden apple before a honeyed almond close. It has surprising freshness for the hot vintage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Martinelli 2017 Pantagruele  (Soave)

Description: Spring wild flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of toasted nut form the nose. On the bright palate, vibrant acidity accompanies yellow peach, apricot and orange zest before closing on notes of bitter almond and saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marangona 2018 Tre Campane  (Lugana)

Description: Intense aromas evoking Spanish broom, citrus and wet stone permeate the glass. Savory, vibrant and restrained, it shows Soave's serious side, delivering yellow pear, golden apple and Meyer lemon. Notes of flinty mineral and a bitter-almond close impart surprising depth—a great showing.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandro de Bruno 2016  Soave Colli Scaligeri

Description: Crisp and savory, this refreshing white has lovely aromas of white stone fruit and wild flowers. Showing classic varietal flavors, the tangy palate doles out ripe pear, apple and citrus before a white-almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Inama 2018 Vin Soave  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tangy and vibrant, this opens with delicate aromas suggesting hawthorn, Mediterranean scrub and white stone fruit. It's racy and linear, delivering yellow pear, peach, Meyer lemon and savory saline mineral notes alongside crisp acidity before a slightly nutty close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Raiano 2018 Ponte dei Santi  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: This tangy, medium-bodied white has inviting aromas of spring wild flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of dried botanical herb. On the savory palate, juicy acidity accompanies white peach, green apple and honeydew melon before closing on a hint of almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feliciana 2019 Felugan  (Lugana)

Description: White spring flower and exotic fruit aromas form the nose. On the savory, refreshing palate, crisp acidity frames grapefruit, apricot and pineapple before a tangy saline finish evoking oyster shell and a hint of bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Mainente 2019 Pigno  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Crisp and savory, this polished white has enticing scents of hawthorn, white stone fruit, apricot and a whiff of citrus. On the savory palate, bright acidity accompanies apple, white peach, Meyer lemon and tangy saline before a white-almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Raiano 2019  Greco di Tufo

Description: Aromas recalling tropical fruit and white spring flower lead the nose. On the savory palate, tangy acidity accompanies white peach, green melon and Meyer lemon before an almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Rugate 2019 San Michele  (Soave Classico)

Description: Fragrant aromas of peach blossom, field flower and ripe white-stone fruit are front and center on the nose. The creamy, savory palate doles out ripe peach, yellow pear and lemon drop alongside bright acidity that gives it a tangy, mouthwatering close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2019 Limne  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of spring blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of exotic fruit shape the nose on this medium-bodied white. On the savory, linear palate, tangy acidity lifts green apple, pear and Mediterranean herb before a lemon drop close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2019 Taburno Coda di Volpe (Sannio)

Description: Made entirely with Garganega grapes and unfiltered, this crisp white has aromas of pressed spring blossom, acacia, honey and toasted nut. The savory, medium-bodied palate sneaks up on you, needing a few minutes in the glass before revealing ripe yellow apple, hazelnut, citrus and saline before a bitter almond finish. Bright acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Adami 2016 Decennale  (Soave)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and precise aromas of lime peel, wet chalk, chiseled rocks and guava peel arise on the nose this bottling of a relatively uncommon grape in California. There's a fresh sizzle to the sip, where honeydew and orange-blossom flavors meet with a flash of petrol.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bartolo 2018 Fiano (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Enticing aromas of spring blossom, grapefruit and tropical fruit shape the nose. On the savory palate, tangy acidity carries flavors of ripe yellow peach, honeydew melon and pineapple before an almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte del Frà 2019  Lugana

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Refreshing and savory, this opens with delicate scents of spring field flower, white stone fruit and Mediterranean herb. On the linear palate, vibrant acidity accompanies yellow pear, green melon and lemon drop before an almost salty close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mustilli 2019  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: This dry, full-bodied and very floral-tasting wine shows strong honeysuckle and butter aromas, rich peach and hibiscus-tea flavors and a tempting texture that combines tangy acidity with creamy richness. Try it for a change of pace.                      Jim Gordon
Name: WineShop At Home 2018 SunFish Malvasia Bianca (California)

Description: Elderflower, exotic fruit and citrus aromas take center stage on this fragrant white. On the bright, savory palate, crisp acidity accompanies juicy grapefruit, apricot before a lemon-drop finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franchetto 2019 La Capelina  (Soave)

Description: Toasted nut, spring blossom and white stone fruit aromas form the delicate nose. The linear, vibrant palate offers yellow apple, apricot and white almond alongside crisp acidity. It closes on a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Stefanini 2018 Monte De Fice  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: Winemaker Sabrine Rodems and proprietor/archaeologist Michael Thomas emulate Roman winemaking, with this skin-contact bottling that's aged in a ceramic vessel. Golden yellow in the glass, the wine offers apple juice and butterscotch on the nose, with a hint of citrus. The palate shows dried citrus and bitter orange. It's funky but enjoyable.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wrath 2017 Ex Dolio Falanghina (Monterey)

Description: Made from grapes cultivated using no chemical fertilizers, pesticides or herbicides, this has delicate, enticing scents of spring blossom, beeswax and pear. Crisp and savory, the racy palate offers white peach, green melon and lemon drop, alongside vibrant acidity before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Balestri Valda 2018  Soave Classico

Description: Pressed Spanish broom, citrus, dried apricot and wet stone aromas mingle together in the glass along with whiffs of botanical herb. It's linear and elegantly structured, delivering unsweetened lemon drop, dried yellow peach, white pepper and flinty mineral alongside crisp acidity. An almond note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandro de Bruno 2016 Monte San Piero  (Soave Superiore)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tropical fruit, hawthorn, sage and Mediterranean brush aromas waft out of the glass. The crisp savory palate features banana, yellow pear and citrus alongside vibrant acidity. It closes on a hint of white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2019 Taburno  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: Spring flower, vanilla and toasted oak aromas shape the nose along with whiffs of beeswax. The aromas follow through to the creamy palate, along with yellow apple and lemon drop. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zenato 2017 Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, acacia honey and beeswax follow to the lavish, concentrated palate, along with dried apricot, lemon drop and a candied note. Tangy acidity supports the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2017 Filo di Arianna Vendemmia Tardiva  (Lugana)

Description: This crisp, refreshing sparkler opens with delicate scents of white stone fruit, hawthorn and a whiff of nut. Reflecting the nose, the vibrant palate offers green apple, white peach and an almond note alongside a light perlage. It's a perfect sparkler to sip on the deck or by the pool.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Tondo NV Brut  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, acacia honey and beeswax follow to the lavish, concentrated palate, along with dried apricot, lemon drop and a candied note. Tangy acidity supports the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2017 Filo di Arianna Vendemmia Tardiva  (Lugana)

Description: Yellow spring flower, apricot and dried herb aromas form the nose. On the racy palate, a honeyed note accents yellow apple, pear and bitter almond before a savory saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattori 2018 Motto Piane  (Soave)

Description: Aged for two years in terra-cotta amphorae, this mineral-driven white has enticing scents of graphite, chopped herb, acacia and dried apricot. Name: Corte Moschina 2016 Eclettico Garganega (Veronese)

Description: Inviting aromas of acacia, ripe apricot, lemon drop and honey waft out of the glass. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors, while an almond note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Fresh and savory, this opens with heady aromas evoking honeysuckle and tropical fruit. Reflecting the nose, the rounded medium-bodied palate offers banana, green melon and lemon drop set against crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe

Description: Delicate aromas of apricot, grapefruit and smoke follow over to the light-bodied, linear palate along with a hint of almond. Racy acidity keeps it crisp.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Buglioni 2018 Musa  (Lugana)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Fresh and savory, this opens with heady aromas evoking honeysuckle and tropical fruit. Reflecting the nose, the rounded medium-bodied palate offers banana, green melon and lemon drop set against crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2019 Serrocielo  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy

Name: Cà Maiol 2019  Lugana

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aged 80% in barriques and casks and 20% in amphora, this opens with aromas of oak, toasted hazelnut and wet stone. The linear palate evokes yellow-apple skin, saline and a dollop of vanilla alongside racy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy

Name: Villa Matilde 2019 Montelapio  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Aromas of elderflower, exotic fruit, hay and a yeasty whiff of bread dough carry on to the savory palate along with grapefruit and white peach. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors while an almond note marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cavalchina 2019 L'Lac  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas evoking toasted nut, oak and cedar waft out of the glass. The aromas follow over to the palate along with vanilla, butterscotch and hints of yellow apple and Meyer lemon.                      Kerin O’Keefe

Kerin O’Keefe

Name: Fattori 2019 Runcaris  (Soave)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spring wild-flower and exotic fruit aromas are front and center. It's crisp and refreshing, offering yellow apple, pineapple and green melon before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2019  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Delicate aromas reminiscent of spring field flower, thyme and yellow stone waft out of the glass. On the crisp palate, racy acidity accompanies golden apple and yellow peach before a zesty finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Stefanini 2018 Monte De Toni  (Soave Classico)

Name: I Stefanini 2018 Monte De Toni  (Soave Classico)

Name: Le Mandolare 2018 Il Roccolo  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of elderflower, Granny Smith apple and a whiff of white almond lead the nose while the rounded palate offers white peach and green melon. Tangy acidity keeps it fresh and juicy.                      Kerin O’Keefe

Description: Made with organically farmed Garganega grapes, this has aromas and flavors of banana, citrus and white almond. Crisp acidity gives it a bright, tangy close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fasoli Gino 2019 Borgoletto  (Soave)

Name: Fattori 2018 Roncha Trebbiano (Veneto)

Name: Starfield 2018 Fiano (El Dorado)

Description: Aromas of lychee, dried yellow fruit and Spanish broom lead the way. It's racy, with crisp acidity and a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Filippi 2018 Monteseroni  (Soave Colli Scaligeri)

Description: Beeswax, cedar and white stone fruit aromas mingle with a whiff of chamomile. On the linear, palate, a hint of vanilla accents Bartlett pear before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bolla 2017 Tufaie  (Soave Classico)

Description: Cedar, pressed yellow-flower, toasted nut and acacia aromas lift out of the glass. Fermented and aged in large casks and barriques, the palate offers oak, butterscotch, mature yellow apple and lemon drop before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Rugate 2017 Monte Alto  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of lychee, acacia and white stone fruit shape the nose along with a whiff of black olive. Fermented with indigenous yeasts, the racy, refreshing palate offers candied citrus zest, dried apricot and a yeasty hint of bread dough.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Martinelli 2018 Il Gigante  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of beeswax, acacia flower and honey lead the nose along with a whiff of white stone fruit. The aromas carry over to the racy palate along with lemon zest before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà Maiol 2018 Molin  (Lugana)

Description: Made with a small amount of late-harvested grapes, this has aromas of fragrant spring blossom, apricot and a whiff of almond. On the tangy palate, bright acidity accompanies yellow peach, grapefruit and a banana note.                      Kerin O’Keefe

Description: Racy and linear, this crisp white has delicate flavors suggesting yellow apple, Meyer lemon and pear. Saline-like mineral notes and bitter almond mark the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe

Name: Borgo La Caccia NV Kames Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)

Description: Bright and enjoyable, this offers apricot and citrus flavors alongside a hint of bitter almond. It's refreshing, with crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Campi 2019 Campo Base  (Soave)

Description: Fragrant and racy, this opens with enticing scents of yellow spring wild flower, graphite and stone fruit. The crisp light-bodied palate offers Meyer lemon and saline notes alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sandro de Bruno 2018  Soave

Description: Made with late-harvested grapes, this has subdued aromas of acacia, honey and hazelnut. Aged in large casks, the aromas follow on to the understated, linear palate along with citrus and bitter almond notes but it's a bit shy on fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Da Mar 2017 Calmo  (Soave Superiore)

Description: Aromas of botanical herb, pear and a whiff of exotic fruit carry over to the palate along with pineapple and brisk acidity. A candied almond note marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Sant'Antonio 2018 Monte Ceriani  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of burnt match, honey and dried peach shape the subtle nose. On the rounded palate, a saline note accompanies dried apricot and bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zambon 2017 le Carvare Vulcano  (Soave)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tropical fruit, honey and apple aromas lead the way. The aromas carry over to the straightforward palate, along with fresh acidity and a hint of nut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nativ 2019  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of lime and white wild flowers form the delicate nose. On the easygoing palate, bright acidity accompanies apple, pineapple and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nativ 2019  Greco di Tufo

Description: Aromas of banana and passion fruit follow over to the light-bodied palate along with peach and citrus. Crisp acidity lifts the fruity flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Armani 2019 Incontro  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and a whiff of honeysuckle form the nose. The palate is crisp and understated, suggesting citrus and pineapple alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Avanzi 2019 Sirmione  (Lugana)

Description: Hawthorn and green-melon aromas form the delicate nose. The green-melon aroma carries over to the crisp, linear palate along with bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Monforte 2019 Vicario  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of honeyed and French oak lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the palate along with coconut, bitter yellow-apple skin and a candied note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Malavasi 2019 San Giacomo  (Lugana)

Description: Light and refreshing, this bright white has delicate aromas of and flavors of yellow stone fruit, apple and a hint of almond. Crisp acidity gives it a clean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zonin 2019  Soave Classico

Description: White spring flower and tropical fruit aromas waft out of the glass. On the crisp palate, racy acidity accompanies grapefruit and pineapple before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Da Mar 2019 Opera Prima  (Soave)

Description: Aromas suggesting white spring blossom and ripe yellow pear carry over to the tangy palate, together with yellow apple and lemon drop. A bitter almond note signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santi 2018 Folàr  (Lugana)

Description: Subtle aromas evoking white stone fruit and spring flower shape the delicate nose. The crisp linear palate offers suggestions of apple and honeydew melon alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Monforte 2018 Foscarino  (Soave Classico)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting acacia flower and beeswax form the subtle nose. The palate is linear and a little lean, offering bitter almond and yellow-apple skin alongside the barest hints of ginger and tangerine rind.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Armani 2018  Lugana

Description: Aged for one year in barriques and one year in steel, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals subdued whiffs suggesting acacia and mature stone fruit. The medium-bodied palate is also quite subdued, evoking hints of dried pineapple and toasted nut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Monteforte 2017 Castellaro  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: This has delicate aromas of spring wild flower and white stone fruit. On the tangy, refreshing palate, crisp acidity accompanies green melon and apple before a lemony finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Soave 2018 Rocca Sveva  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of beeswax lead the nose. The bright, tangy palate offers apricot and a peach note alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Stefanini 2019 Il Selese  (Soave)

Description: Lightly scented, this has subdued aromas suggesting toasted hazelnut and a whiff of chamomile flower. The racy palate evokes notes of yellow-apple skin and bitter almond alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgo La Caccia 2018 Superiore  (Lugana)

Description: This easygoing white has subtle aromas of yellow stone fruit and a hint of white spring flower while the bright palate offers suggestions of peach and citrus. It's simple but well made and refreshing.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte del Frà 2019  Soave Classico

Description: Aromas of field flower and hazelnut form the subtle nose. On the refreshing, light-bodied palate, racy acidity accompanies suggestions of pear and almond. It's simple but well made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nardello 2018 Meridies  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and citrus lead the nose. On the refreshing palate, crisp acidity accompanies pineapple and grapefruit. It's simple but well made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bolla 2018 Retro  (Soave Classico)

Description: Subtle aromas of hawthorn and exotic fruit form the delicate nose while the extremely simple, light-bodied palate suggests peach and pineapple. Crisp acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Casali 2019  Soave

Description: Aromas of banana carry over to the simple palate, along with hints of grapefruit. Tangy acidity lifts the fruity flavors before closing on a bitter almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgo La Caccia 2019  Lugana

Description: Delicate aromas suggesting banana and peach waft out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the simple palate along with a hint of bitter almond and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Erbice 2018  Soave Superiore

Description: Aromas of bitter walnut and citrus carry over to the light-bodied palate along with mature yellow-apple skin. Brisk acidity and steely bubbles provide the racy backdrop.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgo La Caccia 2019 Castigo Brut Metodo Charmat  (Lugana)

Description: This extremely simple wine has a shy nose that offers whiffs of white stone fruit. On the light-bodied, rather diluted palate, you'll fine hints of banana and lemon alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antica Corte 2019  Lugana

Description: The shy nose eventually releases whiffs of tropical fruit. On the extremely simple, diluted palate, brisk acidity accompanies mere suggestions of lemon and almond before a bitter finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' de' Rocchi 2019  Lugana

Description: The shy nose eventually releases whiffs of tropical fruit. On the extremely simple, diluted palate, brisk acidity accompanies mere suggestions of lemon and almond before a bitter finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' de' Rocchi 2019  Lugana

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Exotic-fruit, pear and white-spring-flower aromas mingle together with a delicate whiff of smoke. The savory, vibrant palate features white stone fruit, lemon drop and a hint of honeyed almond alongside tangy acidity. A saline note adds depth.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mastroberardino 2019 Radici  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this offers aromas of spring blossom and white stone fruit. Round and medium-bodied, the palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, white peach and a hint of baking spice, alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bucci 2018  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Vibrant and savory, this linear white has delicate aromas of white stone fruit, citrus and floral notes. On the refreshing, delicious palate, saline and white-almond notes underscore white peach and Meyer lemon alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mustilli 2019 Greco (Sannio)

Description: Enticing aromas of fragrant spring wild flower and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. Tangy and delicious, the crisp palate offers green apple, apricot and citrus alongside bright acidity. A saline note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Selva 2018 Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: A mix of wood and clay amphoras were used to ferment and age this wine. After an extra year, the wine has revealed a beautiful texture, smooth and packed with ripe apple flavors. A touch of toast flits in the background. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand Boise 2018 Cuvée 1610 Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of spring wild flower, apricot, wet stone and beeswax mingle together. The vibrant, medium-bodied palate features white peach, pear and a honeyed note before a bitter-almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mastroberardino 2018 NovaSerra  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Profuse aromas of chamomile and lemon carry the nose of this balanced white, with ripe melon filling out the rounded palate. The ultrabright acidity typical of the variety is integrated well, highlighting all the fruit and floral tones. The finish resolves well, with a slight white-tea-like grip.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Umani Ronchi 2018 Vellodoro Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Description: Waxy green apple and sour cherry dot the landscape of this textured, freshly energetic wine, which shows briny, savory personality. It finishes in a fresh bite of peach.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Fleur de California 2018 Estate Vineyards Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: White spring-flower, yellow stone-fruit and almond aromas form the nose. On the bright palate, crisp acidity accompanies yellow peach and grapefruit before a saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Campo alle Comete 2018 Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Vinified partly in terracotta amphora, partly in steel and partly on the skins in steel vats, this opens with aromas of ripe yellow stone fruit, acacia and walnut. Mirroring the nose, the rather understated palate offers apricot, chestnut honey and a hint of mineral before closing on a bitter-almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mazzei 2018 Codice Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with organically farmed Vermentino, this opens with aromas of Spanish broom and orchard fruit. The savory palate offers Bartlett pear, white peach and ginger alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Prelius 2018 Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Aromas of pretty yellow blossoms, apple and melon show on the well-formed nose of this organic Trebbiano. Rounded in feel, the palate shows ripe fruit balanced by a lifted vein of lemon balm. It's a delicious, well-balanced white that will please many.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Umani Ronchi 2018 Montipagano Organic  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Mature apricot, wild-herb and citrus aromas are front and center. The aromas carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with crisp acidity before a bitter-almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santa Lucia 2018 Brigante Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: A zesty nose of lemon peel and chamomile starts this off, with a bit of stoniness riding underneath. Medium in weight, the palate is driven by red apple and lemon balm, showing plenty of acidity to keep it crisp and refreshing.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Ripa Teatina 2018 Arenile  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This cloudy Malvasia is clearly unfiltered and unfined. Aromas of tangerine and lychee are equal parts citric and tropical, while this feels leesy and offers good concentration on the palate. Exotic flavors suggest lychee nut, with a steady finish that's floral and not bitter like many wines of this ilk.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Escala Humana 2019 Livverá Malvasia (Tupungato)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: A quiet nose of melon, chamomile and lemon starts off this white, with plush, juicy flavors carrying to the palate. There's a real zip of energy to the acidity, which provides ample lift throughout. The finish is quick on a brisk lemon-tonic note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2018 Agronika Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Description: Fermented 50% in oak, 34% in amphora and the rest in steel, this has aromas of dried tropical fruit, apricot and Mediterranean scrub. The medium-bodied palate is lean in terms of fruit richness, opening with crushed mint while the finish shows dried pineapple and candied notes before a firm, bitter close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Val delle Rose 2017 Cobalto Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Aromas of struck match and popcorn-kernel arise on the nose, with a bit of seared lemon riding in the background. Half of this wine sees time in neutral tonneaux for about 12 months, yielding a rounded, almost silken feel. Ample acidity does well to lift up the palate, with defined flavors of melon and sour lemon riding through the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Umani Ronchi 2017 Centovie Pecorino (Colli Aprutini)

Description: Here's a fun, friendly white with aromas of tropical fruit and apricot. The aromas follow over to the tangy palate, along with grapefruit and a candied note set against crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Banfi 2018 La Pettegola Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Deeply yellow in color, this has aromas recalling toasted almond, Mediterranean scrub and yeasty whiffs of bread crust. On the linear palate, tangy acidity and a hint of saline accompany dried apricot and gooseberry.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Casa di Terra 2018 Vermentino (Bolgheri)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of fresh spring blossoms, candied lemon peel and melon rind carry the nose. The palate shows a pleasing roundness, with a mix of tart citrus and apple flavors. It's a fine, zesty drop that would be delightful alone or alongside fresh salads and grilled poultry.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina Valle Tritana 2018 Passerina (Terre di Chieti)

Description: This tangy white has subtle scents of yellow stone fruit and a whiff of botanical herb. On the light-bodied palate, crisp acidity accompanies apricot and lemon zest before a bitter-almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria di Magliano 2018 Pagliatura Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Tangy and bright, this has aromas of orange blossom and honeydew melon. The fruit aromas carry over to the zesty palate, along with citrus and a hint of white stone fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Val delle Rose 2018 Litorale Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Like all Provence whites this is a limited-production wine. It has a lemon tang, with zest and minerality giving texture and bringing out the crisp apple fruit. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Grand Boise 2019 Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

Description: This fleshy white offers loads of honeydew, lemon oil and chamomile tones. It's rounded and ripe in feel, lifted by a strong citric element that resolves well on the creamy melon finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2018 Rocky Marciano Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: A lifted, fruity nose of lemon, muskmelon and banana carries to the medium-bodied palate. Bright acidity pushes through, lending good balance to the straightforward nature of this wine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Zambra 2018 Colle Maggio Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: This is a juicy, lightly perfumed wine, with crisp apple flavors and fresh acidity. It is immediately attractive and refreshing, perfect for summer enjoyment.                      Roger Voss
Name: Emma M. Louise 2019 Terre de Mistral Vermentino (Mediterranée)

Description: Aromas of lemon balm, chamomile and melon rind show on the fresh, lifted nose. Juicy in feel, the palate delivers a pleasing mix of apple and melon, lifted by bright shots of lemon. This is a great buy for those searching for a balanced medium-bodied white.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Citra 2018 Estate Grown  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of lemon peel, green melon rind and medicinal herbs carry the pretty nose.There's a silkiness to the palate, with bright, racy acidity pushing through. This is a zesty vibrant pour that ends with a lemon-drop tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2018 Agronika Passerina (Terre di Chieti)

Description: Subtle aromas suggesting yellow stone fruit and beeswax form the nose. On the vibrant, light-bodied palate, bright acidity accompanies apricot and an acacia-honey note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Podere San Cristoforo 2018 Luminosa Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Tangy and bright, this has subtle aromas of yellow apple and a whiff of apricot. Mirroring the nose, the easygoing palate offers yellow peach and a hint of white almond alongside fresh acidity. It's simple but well made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Mantellassi 2018 Lucumone Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Toasted nut, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of dried herb aromas form the subtle nose. The light-bodied rather diluted palate offers suggestions of peach, yellow apple and lemon alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rocca di Frassinello 2018 Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Bright, crisp aromas of candied apple and lemon carry the nose, with a wilted floral tone riding in the background. The light-bodied palate shows a mix of sweet and tart fruit that end short on the clipped finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Torre Zambra 2019 Madia  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: This ripe Pecorino offers mild aromas of melon, lemon and chamomile on the nose, which carry to the slightly oily palate. Bright acidity does well to lift the feel on the midpalate, generating a sharp contrast between honeydew and citrus flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: La Valentina 2018 Pecorino (Colline Pescaresi)

Description: Gentle notes of lemon and pine meld with a stalky yellow-flower core on the nose. There's roundness to the palate, yet bright acidity shines through—almost sharp at first, but then turns more tame. Tight flavors of lemon and underripe white plum finish with a load of tang.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pasetti 2018 Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: Brisk aromas of lemon peel and chamomile carry the nose. The palate is shot through with sour tones of citrus, white cherry and white plum. This is a zippy, ultrafresh white that needs food to tame all that acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2018 Monatic White Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: This white is rather quiet on the nose, not revealing many charms. The palate is full in feel, with ample acidic lift, but the flavors are mild and lean toward sour lemon and melon rind.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2018 Giulia Pecorino

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a slight haze to this bottling, which begins with intriguing aromas of tart citrus, wet wool and tangy lemon, like meandering through a damp lemon orchard. There's a grippy texture to the palate, where sour lemon candies and perfumed orange-blossom flavors meet with guava peel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lost Blues 2018 Luckpenny Malvasia Bianca (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Description: Aromas of red berries, violet and leather lead the nose on this medium-bodied red. Made entirely with organically grown Ciliegiolo grapes, the juicy palate offers raspberry preserves, clove and cinnamon alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Selva 2015  Maremma Toscana

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and fresh aromas of lemon pith and pear flesh meet with a cement-like minerality on the nose of this bottling. There is compelling grip to the sip, where a chalky texture carries austere flavors of grapefruit pith, lime peel and lemon-laced spring water.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Palmina 2018 Vermentino (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Aromas of beeswax, yellow wild flower, stone fruit and honey form the delicate nose, along with the barest whiff of petrol. Smooth, enveloping and savory, the palate offers mature apricot, yellow peach, lemon zest and honeyed nut before a saline finish. Fresh acidity lifts the finish. It's already delicious but hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Roagna 2017 Derthona Montemarzino Timorasso (Vino Bianco d'Italia)
